2271: 
2272:             if ( $oldName !== $this->via ) {
2273:                 //set the new renaming rule
2274:                 $writer->renameAssocTable( $oldName, $this->via );
2275:                 $this->via = NULL;
2276:             }
2277:         }
2278: 
2279:         $type  = $this->beau( $type );
2280:         $count = 0;
2281: 
2282:         if ( $this->getID() ) {
2283:             $count = $redbean->getAssociationManager()->relatedCount( $this, $type, $this->withSql, $this->withParams, TRUE );
2284:         }
2285: 
2286:         $this->clearModifiers();
2287:         return (integer) $count;
2288:     }
2289: 
2290:     /**
2291:      * Tests whether the database identities of two beans are equal.
2292:      *
2293:      * @param OODBBean $bean other bean
2294:      *
2295:      * @return boolean
2296:      */
2297:     public function equals(OODBBean $bean)
2298:     {
2299:         return (bool) (
2300:                ( (string) $this->properties['id'] === (string) $bean->properties['id'] )
2301:             && ( (string) $this->__info['type']   === (string) $bean->__info['type']   )
2302:         );
2303:     }
2304: 
2305: 
2306: }
2307: } 
2308: 
2309: namespace RedBeanPHP {
2310: 
2311: use RedBeanPHP\Observer as Observer;
2312: 
2313: /**
2314:  * Observable
2315:  * Base class for Observables
2316:  *
2317:  * @file            RedBean/Observable.php
2318:  * @description     Part of the observer pattern in RedBean
2319:  * @author          Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP community
2320:  * @license         BSD/GPLv2
2321:  *
2322:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
2323:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
2324:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
2325:  */
2326: abstract class Observable { //bracket must be here - otherwise coverage software does not understand.
2327: 
2328:     /**
2329:      * @var array
2330:      */
2331:     private $observers = array();
2332: 
2333:     /**
2334:      * Implementation of the Observer Pattern.
2335:      * Adds an event listener to the observable object.
2336:      * First argument should be the name of the event you wish to listen for.
2337:      * Second argument should be the object that wants to be notified in case
2338:      * the event occurs.
2339:      *
2340:      * @param string           $eventname event identifier
2341:      * @param Observer $observer  observer instance
2342:      *
2343:      * @return void
2344:      */
2345:     public function addEventListener( $eventname, Observer $observer )
2346:     {
2347:         if ( !isset( $this->observers[$eventname] ) ) {
2348:             $this->observers[$eventname] = array();
2349:         }
2350: 
2351:         foreach ( $this->observers[$eventname] as $o ) {
2352:             if ( $o == $observer ) {
2353:                 return;
2354:             }
2355:         }
2356: 
2357:         $this->observers[$eventname][] = $observer;
2358:     }
2359: 
2360:     /**
2361:      * Notifies listeners.
2362:      * Sends the signal $eventname, the event identifier and a message object
2363:      * to all observers that have been registered to receive notification for
2364:      * this event. Part of the observer pattern implementation in RedBeanPHP.
2365:      *
2366:      * @param string $eventname event you want signal
2367:      * @param mixed  $info      message object to send along
2368:      *
2369:      * @return void
2370:      */
2371:     public function signal( $eventname, $info )
2372:     {
2373:         if ( !isset( $this->observers[$eventname] ) ) {
2374:             $this->observers[$eventname] = array();
2375:         }
2376: 
2377:         foreach ( $this->observers[$eventname] as $observer ) {
2378:             $observer->onEvent( $eventname, $info );
2379:         }
2380:     }
2381: }
2382: } 
2383: 
2384: namespace RedBeanPHP {
2385: 
2386: /**
2387:  * Observer
2388:  * Interface for Observer object. Implementation of the
2389:  * observer pattern.
2390:  *
2391:  * @file    RedBean/Observer.php
2392:  * @desc    Part of the observer pattern in RedBean
2393:  * @author  Gabor de Mooijand the RedBeanPHP community
2394:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
2395:  *
2396:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
2397:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
2398:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
2399:  */
2400: interface Observer
2401: {
2402: 
2403:     /**
2404:      * An observer object needs to be capable of receiving
2405:      * notifications. Therefore the observer needs to implement the
2406:      * onEvent method with two parameters, the event identifier specifying the
2407:      * current event and a message object (in RedBeanPHP this can also be a bean).
2408:      * 
2409:      * @param string $eventname event identifier
2410:      * @param mixed  $bean      a message sent along with the notification
2411:      *
2412:      * @return void
2413:      */
2414:     public function onEvent( $eventname, $bean );
2415: }
2416: } 
2417: 
2418: namespace RedBeanPHP {
2419: 
2420: /**
2421:  * Adapter Interface
2422:  *
2423:  * @file    RedBean/Adapter.php
2424:  * @desc    Describes the API for a RedBean Database Adapter.
2425:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
2426:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
2427:  *
2428:  * (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
2429:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
2430:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
2431:  */
2432: interface Adapter
2433: {
2434: 
2435:     /**
2436:      * Returns the latest SQL statement
2437:      *
2438:      * @return string
2439:      */
2440:     public function getSQL();
2441: 
2442:     /**
2443:      * Executes an SQL Statement using an array of values to bind
2444:      * If $noevent is TRUE then this function will not signal its
2445:      * observers to notify about the SQL execution; this to prevent
2446:      * infinite recursion when using observers.
2447:      *
2448:      * @param string  $sql      SQL
2449:      * @param array   $bindings values
2450:      * @param boolean $noevent  no event firing
2451:      */
2452:     public function exec( $sql, $bindings = array(), $noevent = FALSE );
2453: 
2454:     /**
2455:      * Executes an SQL Query and returns a resultset.
2456:      * This method returns a multi dimensional resultset similar to getAll
2457:      * The values array can be used to bind values to the place holders in the
2458:      * SQL query.
2459:      *
2460:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2461:      * @param array  $bindings values
2462:      *
2463:      * @return array
2464:      */
2465:     public function get( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2466: 
2467:     /**
2468:      * Executes an SQL Query and returns a resultset.
2469:      * This method returns a single row (one array) resultset.
2470:      * The values array can be used to bind values to the place holders in the
2471:      * SQL query.
2472:      *
2473:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2474:      * @param array  $bindings values to bind
2475:      *
2476:      * @return array
2477:      */
2478:     public function getRow( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2479: 
2480:     /**
2481:      * Executes an SQL Query and returns a resultset.
2482:      * This method returns a single column (one array) resultset.
2483:      * The values array can be used to bind values to the place holders in the
2484:      * SQL query.
2485:      *
2486:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2487:      * @param array  $bindings values to bind
2488:      *
2489:      * @return array
2490:      */
2491:     public function getCol( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2492: 
2493:     /**
2494:      * Executes an SQL Query and returns a resultset.
2495:      * This method returns a single cell, a scalar value as the resultset.
2496:      * The values array can be used to bind values to the place holders in the
2497:      * SQL query.
2498:      *
2499:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2500:      * @param array  $bindings values to bind
2501:      *
2502:      * @return string
2503:      */
2504:     public function getCell( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2505: 
2506:     /**
2507:      * Executes the SQL query specified in $sql and takes
2508:      * the first two columns of the resultset. This function transforms the
2509:      * resultset into an associative array. Values from the the first column will
2510:      * serve as keys while the values of the second column will be used as values.
2511:      * The values array can be used to bind values to the place holders in the
2512:      * SQL query.
2513:      *
2514:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2515:      * @param array  $bindings values to bind
2516:      *
2517:      * @return array
2518:      */
2519:     public function getAssoc( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2520:     
2521:     /**
2522:      * Executes the SQL query specified in $sql and indexes
2523:      * the row by the first column.
2524:      * 
2525:      * @param string $sql      SQL
2526:      * @param array  $bindings values to bind
2527:      *
2528:      * @return array
2529:      */
2530:     public function getAssocRow( $sql, $bindings = array() );
2531: 
2532:     /**
2533:      * Returns the latest insert ID.
2534:      *
2535:      * @return integer
2536:      */
2537:     public function getInsertID();
2538: 
2539:     /**
2540:      * Returns the number of rows that have been
2541:      * affected by the last update statement.
2542:      *
2543:      * @return integer
2544:      */
2545:     public function getAffectedRows();
2546: 
2547:     /**
2548:      * Returns the original database resource. This is useful if you want to
2549:      * perform operations on the driver directly instead of working with the
2550:      * adapter. RedBean will only access the adapter and never to talk
2551:      * directly to the driver though.
2552:      *
2553:      * @return object
2554:      */
2555:     public function getDatabase();
2556: 
2557:     /**
2558:      * This method is part of the RedBean Transaction Management
2559:      * mechanisms.
2560:      * Starts a transaction.
2561:      *
2562:      * @return void
2563:      */
2564:     public function startTransaction();
2565: 
2566:     /**
2567:      * This method is part of the RedBean Transaction Management
2568:      * mechanisms.
2569:      * Commits the transaction.
2570:      *
2571:      * @return void
2572:      */
2573:     public function commit();
2574: 
2575:     /**
2576:      * This method is part of the RedBean Transaction Management
2577:      * mechanisms.
2578:      * Rolls back the transaction.
2579:      *
2580:      * @return void
2581:      */
2582:     public function rollback();
2583: 
2584:     /**
2585:      * Closes database connection.
2586:      *
2587:      * @return void
2588:      */
2589:     public function close();
2590: }
2591: }
2592: 
2593: namespace RedBeanPHP\Adapter {
2594: 
2595: use RedBeanPHP\Observable as Observable;
2596: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter as Adapter;
2597: use RedBeanPHP\Driver as Driver;
2598: 
2599: /**
2600:  * DBAdapter (Database Adapter)
2601:  *
2602:  * @file    RedBean/Adapter/DBAdapter.php
2603:  * @desc    An adapter class to connect various database systems to RedBean
2604:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
2605:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
2606:  *
2607:  * Database Adapter Class.
2608:  *
2609:  * (c) copyright G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP community.
2610:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
2611:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
2612:  */
2613: class DBAdapter extends Observable implements Adapter
2614: {
2615: 
2616:     /**
2617:      * @var Driver
2618:      */
2619:     private $db = NULL;
2620: 
2621:     /**
2622:      * @var string
2623:      */
2624:     private $sql = '';
2625: 
2626:     /**
2627:      * Constructor.
2628:      *
2629:      * Creates an instance of the RedBean Adapter Class.
2630:      * This class provides an interface for RedBean to work
2631:      * with ADO compatible DB instances.
2632:      *
2633:      * @param Driver $database ADO Compatible DB Instance
2634:      */
2635:     public function __construct( $database )
2636:     {
2637:         $this->db = $database;
2638:     }
2639: 
2640:     /**
2641:      * @see Adapter::getSQL
2642:      */
2643:     public function getSQL()
2644:     {
2645:         return $this->sql;
2646:     }
2647: 
2648:     /**
2649:      * @see Adapter::exec
2650:      */
2651:     public function exec( $sql, $bindings = array(), $noevent = FALSE )
2652:     {
2653:         if ( !$noevent ) {
2654:             $this->sql = $sql;
2655:             $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2656:         }
2657: 
2658:         return $this->db->Execute( $sql, $bindings );
2659:     }
2660: 
2661:     /**
2662:      * @see Adapter::get
2663:      */
2664:     public function get( $sql, $bindings = array() )
2665:     {
2666:         $this->sql = $sql;
2667:         $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2668: 
2669:         return $this->db->GetAll( $sql, $bindings );
2670:     }
2671: 
2672:     /**
2673:      * @see Adapter::getRow
2674:      */
2675:     public function getRow( $sql, $bindings = array() )
2676:     {
2677:         $this->sql = $sql;
2678:         $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2679: 
2680:         return $this->db->GetRow( $sql, $bindings );
2681:     }
2682: 
2683:     /**
2684:      * @see Adapter::getCol
2685:      */
2686:     public function getCol( $sql, $bindings = array() )
2687:     {
2688:         $this->sql = $sql;
2689:         $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2690: 
2691:         return $this->db->GetCol( $sql, $bindings );
2692:     }
2693: 
2694:     /**
2695:      * @see Adapter::getAssoc
2696:      */
2697:     public function getAssoc( $sql, $bindings = array() )
2698:     {
2699:         $this->sql = $sql;
2700: 
2701:         $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2702: 
2703:         $rows  = $this->db->GetAll( $sql, $bindings );
2704: 
2705:         $assoc = array();
2706:         if ( !$rows ) {
2707:             return $assoc;
2708:         }
2709: 
2710:         foreach ( $rows as $row ) {
2711:             if ( empty( $row ) ) continue;
2712: 
2713:             if ( count( $row ) > 1 ) {
2714:                 $key   = array_shift( $row );
2715:                 $value = array_shift( $row );
2716:             } else {
2717:                 $key   = array_shift( $row );
2718:                 $value = $key;
2719:             }
2720: 
2721:             $assoc[$key] = $value;
2722:         }
2723: 
2724:         return $assoc;
2725:     }
2726:     
2727:     /**
2728:      * @see Adapter::getAssocRow
2729:      */
2730:     public function getAssocRow($sql, $bindings = array())
2731:     {
2732:         $this->sql = $sql;
2733:         $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2734: 
2735:         return $this->db->GetAssocRow( $sql, $bindings );
2736:     }
2737: 
2738:     /**
2739:      * @see Adapter::getCell
2740:      */
2741:     public function getCell( $sql, $bindings = array(), $noSignal = NULL )
2742:     {
2743:         $this->sql = $sql;
2744: 
2745:         if ( !$noSignal ) $this->signal( 'sql_exec', $this );
2746: 
2747:         $arr = $this->db->getCol( $sql, $bindings );
2748: 
2749:         if ( $arr && is_array( $arr ) && isset( $arr[0] ) ) {
2750:             return ( $arr[0] );
2751:         }
2752: 
2753:         return NULL;
2754:     }
2755: 
2756:     /**
2757:      * @see Adapter::getInsertID
2758:      */
2759:     public function getInsertID()
2760:     {
2761:         return $this->db->getInsertID();
2762:     }
2763: 
2764:     /**
2765:      * @see Adapter::getAffectedRows
2766:      */
2767:     public function getAffectedRows()
2768:     {
2769:         return $this->db->Affected_Rows();
2770:     }
2771: 
2772:     /**
2773:      * @see Adapter::getDatabase
2774:      */
2775:     public function getDatabase()
2776:     {
2777:         return $this->db;
2778:     }
2779: 
2780:     /**
2781:      * @see Adapter::startTransaction
2782:      */
2783:     public function startTransaction()
2784:     {
2785:         $this->db->StartTrans();
2786:     }
2787: 
2788:     /**
2789:      * @see Adapter::commit
2790:      */
2791:     public function commit()
2792:     {
2793:         $this->db->CommitTrans();
2794:     }
2795: 
2796:     /**
2797:      * @see Adapter::rollback
2798:      */
2799:     public function rollback()
2800:     {
2801:         $this->db->FailTrans();
2802:     }
2803: 
2804:     /**
2805:      * @see Adapter::close.
2806:      */
2807:     public function close()
2808:     {
2809:         $this->db->close();
2810:     }
2811: }
2812: }
2813: 
2814: namespace RedBeanPHP {
2815: 
2816: /**
2817:  * QueryWriter
2818:  * Interface for QueryWriters
2819:  *
2820:  * @file    RedBean/QueryWriter.php
2821:  * @desc    Describes the API for a QueryWriter
2822:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP community
2823:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
2824:  *
2825:  * Notes:
2826:  * - Whenever you see a parameter called $table or $type you should always
2827:  * be aware of the fact that this argument contains a Bean Type string, not the
2828:  * actual table name. These raw type names are passed to safeTable() to obtain the
2829:  * actual name of the database table. Don't let the names confuse you $type/$table
2830:  * refers to Bean Type, not physical database table names!
2831:  * - This is the interface for FLUID database drivers. Drivers intended to support
2832:  * just FROZEN mode should implement the IceWriter instead.
2833:  *
2834:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
2835:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
2836:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
2837:  */
2838: interface QueryWriter
2839: {
2840: 
2841:     /**
2842:      * Query Writer constants.
2843:      */
2844:     const C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_TABLE                  = 1;
2845:     const C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_COLUMN                 = 2;
2846:     const C_SQLSTATE_INTEGRITY_CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION = 3;
2847: 
2848:     /**
2849:      * Define data type regions
2850:      *
2851:      * 00 - 80: normal data types
2852:      * 80 - 99: special data types, only scan/code if requested
2853:      * 99     : specified by user, don't change
2854:      */
2855:     const C_DATATYPE_RANGE_SPECIAL   = 80;
2856:     const C_DATATYPE_RANGE_SPECIFIED = 99;
2857: 
2858:     /**
2859:      * Define GLUE types for use with glueSQLCondition methods.
2860:      * Determines how to prefix a snippet of SQL before appending it
2861:      * to other SQL (or integrating it, mixing it otherwise).
2862:      *
2863:      * WHERE - glue as WHERE condition
2864:      * AND   - glue as AND condition
2865:      */
2866:     const C_GLUE_WHERE = 1;
2867:     const C_GLUE_AND   = 2;
2868: 
2869:     /**
2870:      * Glues an SQL snippet to the beginning of a WHERE clause.
2871:      * This ensures users don't have to add WHERE to their query snippets.
2872:      *
2873:      * The snippet gets prefixed with WHERE or AND
2874:      * if it starts with a condition.
2875:      *
2876:      * If the snippet does NOT start with a condition (or this function thinks so)
2877:      * the snippet is returned as-is.
2878:      *
2879:      * The GLUE type determines the prefix:
2880:      *
2881:      * - NONE  prefixes with WHERE
2882:      * - WHERE prefixes with WHERE and replaces AND if snippets starts with AND
2883:      * - AND   prefixes with AND
2884:      *
2885:      * This method will never replace WHERE with AND since a snippet should never
2886:      * begin with WHERE in the first place. OR is not supported.
2887:      *
2888:      * Only a limited set of clauses will be recognized as non-conditions.
2889:      * For instance beginning a snippet with complex statements like JOIN or UNION
2890:      * will not work. This is too complex for use in a snippet.
2891:      *
2892:      * @param string  $sql   SQL Snippet
2893:      * @param integer $glue  the GLUE type - how to glue (C_GLUE_WHERE or C_GLUE_AND)
2894:      *
2895:      * @return string
2896:      */
2897:     public function glueSQLCondition( $sql, $glue = NULL );
2898: 
2899:     /**
2900:      * Returns the tables that are in the database.
2901:      *
2902:      * @return array
2903:      */
2904:     public function getTables();
2905: 
2906:     /**
2907:      * This method will create a table for the bean.
2908:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
2909:      *
2910:      * @param string $type type of bean you want to create a table for
2911:      *
2912:      * @return void
2913:      */
2914:     public function createTable( $type );
2915: 
2916:     /**
2917:      * Returns an array containing all the columns of the specified type.
2918:      * The format of the return array looks like this:
2919:      * $field => $type where $field is the name of the column and $type
2920:      * is a database specific description of the datatype.
2921:      *
2922:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
2923:      *
2924:      * @param string $type type of bean you want to obtain a column list of
2925:      *
2926:      * @return array
2927:      */
2928:     public function getColumns( $type );
2929: 
2930:     /**
2931:      * Returns the Column Type Code (integer) that corresponds
2932:      * to the given value type. This method is used to determine the minimum
2933:      * column type required to represent the given value.
2934:      *
2935:      * @param string $value value
2936:      *
2937:      * @return integer
2938:      */
2939:     public function scanType( $value, $alsoScanSpecialForTypes = FALSE );
2940: 
2941:     /**
2942:      * This method will add a column to a table.
2943:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
2944:      *
2945:      * @param string  $type   name of the table
2946:      * @param string  $column name of the column
2947:      * @param integer $field  data type for field
2948:      *
2949:      * @return void
2950:      */
2951:     public function addColumn( $type, $column, $field );
2952: 
2953:     /**
2954:      * Returns the Type Code for a Column Description.
2955:      * Given an SQL column description this method will return the corresponding
2956:      * code for the writer. If the include specials flag is set it will also
2957:      * return codes for special columns. Otherwise special columns will be identified
2958:      * as specified columns.
2959:      *
2960:      * @param string  $typedescription description
2961:      * @param boolean $includeSpecials whether you want to get codes for special columns as well
2962:      *
2963:      * @return integer
2964:      */
2965:     public function code( $typedescription, $includeSpecials = FALSE );
2966: 
2967:     /**
2968:      * This method will widen the column to the specified data type.
2969:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
2970:      *
2971:      * @param string  $type       type / table that needs to be adjusted
2972:      * @param string  $column     column that needs to be altered
2973:      * @param integer $datatype   target data type
2974:      *
2975:      * @return void
2976:      */
2977:     public function widenColumn( $type, $column, $datatype );
2978: 
2979:     /**
2980:      * Selects records from the database.
2981:      * This methods selects the records from the database that match the specified
2982:      * type, conditions (optional) and additional SQL snippet (optional).
2983:      *
2984:      * @param string $type       name of the table you want to query
2985:      * @param array  $conditions criteria ( $column => array( $values ) )
2986:      * @param string $addSQL     additional SQL snippet
2987:      * @param array  $bindings   bindings for SQL snippet
2988:      *
2989:      * @return array
2990:      */
2991:     public function queryRecord( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = NULL, $bindings = array() );
2992: 
2993:     /**
2994:      * Returns records through an intermediate type. This method is used to obtain records using a link table and
2995:      * allows the SQL snippets to reference columns in the link table for additional filtering or ordering.
2996:      *
2997:      * @param string $sourceType source type, the reference type you want to use to fetch related items on the other side
2998:      * @param string $destType   destination type, the target type you want to get beans of
2999:      * @param mixed  $linkID     ID to use for the link table
3000:      * @param string $addSql     Additional SQL snippet
3001:      * @param array  $bindings   Bindings for SQL snippet
3002:      *
3003:      * @return array
3004:      */
3005:     public function queryRecordRelated( $sourceType, $destType, $linkID, $addSql = '', $bindings = array() );
3006: 
3007:     /**
3008:      * Returns the row that links $sourceType $sourcID to $destType $destID in an N-M relation.
3009:      *
3010:      * @param string $sourceType source type, the first part of the link you're looking for
3011:      * @param string $destType   destination type, the second part of the link you're looking for
3012:      * @param string $sourceID   ID for the source
3013:      * @param string $destID     ID for the destination
3014:      *
3015:      * @return array|null
3016:      */
3017:     public function queryRecordLink( $sourceType, $destType, $sourceID, $destID );
3018: 
3019:     /**
3020:      * Counts the number of records in the database that match the
3021:      * conditions and additional SQL.
3022:      *
3023:      * @param string $type       name of the table you want to query
3024:      * @param array  $conditions criteria ( $column => array( $values ) )
3025:      * @param string $addSQL     additional SQL snippet
3026:      * @param array  $bindings   bindings for SQL snippet
3027:      *
3028:      * @return integer
3029:      */
3030:     public function queryRecordCount( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = NULL, $bindings = array() );
3031: 
3032:     /**
3033:      * Returns the number of records linked through $linkType and satisfying the SQL in $addSQL/$bindings.
3034:      *
3035:      * @param string $sourceType source type
3036:      * @param string $targetType the thing you want to count
3037:      * @param mixed  $linkID     the of the source type
3038:      * @param string $addSQL     additional SQL snippet
3039:      * @param array  $bindings   bindings for SQL snippet
3040:      *
3041:      * @return integer
3042:      */
3043:     public function queryRecordCountRelated( $sourceType, $targetType, $linkID, $addSQL = '', $bindings = array() );
3044: 
3045:     /**
3046:      * This method should update (or insert a record), it takes
3047:      * a table name, a list of update values ( $field => $value ) and an
3048:      * primary key ID (optional). If no primary key ID is provided, an
3049:      * INSERT will take place.
3050:      * Returns the new ID.
3051:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
3052:      *
3053:      * @param string  $type            name of the table to update
3054:      * @param array   $updatevalues    list of update values
3055:      * @param integer $id              optional primary key ID value
3056:      *
3057:      * @return integer
3058:      */
3059:     public function updateRecord( $type, $updatevalues, $id = NULL );
3060: 
3061:     /**
3062:      * Deletes records from the database.
3063:      * @note $addSql is always prefixed with ' WHERE ' or ' AND .'
3064:      *
3065:      * @param string $type       name of the table you want to query
3066:      * @param array  $conditions criteria ( $column => array( $values ) )
3067:      * @param string $sql        additional SQL
3068:      * @param array  $bindings   bindings
3069:      *
3070:      * @return void
3071:      */
3072:     public function deleteRecord( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = '', $bindings = array() );
3073: 
3074:     /**
3075:      * Deletes all links between $sourceType and $destType in an N-M relation.
3076:      *
3077:      * @param string $sourceType source type
3078:      * @param string $destType   destination type
3079:      * @param string $sourceID   source ID
3080:      *
3081:      * @return void
3082:      */
3083:     public function deleteRelations( $sourceType, $destType, $sourceID );
3084: 
3085:     /**
3086:      * This method will add a UNIQUE constraint index to a table on columns $columns.
3087:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
3088:      *
3089:      * @param string $type               type
3090:      * @param array  $columnsPartOfIndex columns to include in index
3091:      *
3092:      * @return void
3093:      */
3094:     public function addUniqueIndex( $type, $columns );
3095: 
3096:     /**
3097:      * This method will check whether the SQL state is in the list of specified states
3098:      * and returns TRUE if it does appear in this list or FALSE if it
3099:      * does not. The purpose of this method is to translate the database specific state to
3100:      * a one of the constants defined in this class and then check whether it is in the list
3101:      * of standard states provided.
3102:      *
3103:      * @param string $state sql state
3104:      * @param array  $list  list
3105:      *
3106:      * @return boolean
3107:      */
3108:     public function sqlStateIn( $state, $list );
3109: 
3110:     /**
3111:      * This method will remove all beans of a certain type.
3112:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
3113:      *
3114:      * @param  string $type bean type
3115:      *
3116:      * @return void
3117:      */
3118:     public function wipe( $type );
3119: 
3120:     /**
3121:      * Given two types this method will add a foreign key constraint.
3122:      *
3123:      * @param string $sourceType source type
3124:      * @param string $destType   destination type
3125:      *
3126:      * @return void
3127:      */
3128:     public function addConstraintForTypes( $sourceType, $destType );
3129: 
3130:     /**
3131:      * This method will add a foreign key from type and field to
3132:      * target type and target field.
3133:      * The foreign key is created without an action. On delete/update
3134:      * no action will be triggered. The FK is only used to allow database
3135:      * tools to generate pretty diagrams and to make it easy to add actions
3136:      * later on.
3137:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
3138:      *
3139:      *
3140:      * @param  string $type        type that will have a foreign key field
3141:      * @param  string $targetType  points to this type
3142:      * @param  string $field       field that contains the foreign key value
3143:      * @param  string $targetField field where the fk points to
3144:      * @param  string $isDep       whether target is dependent and should cascade on update/delete
3145:      *
3146:      * @return void
3147:      */
3148:     public function addFK( $type, $targetType, $field, $targetField, $isDep = false );
3149: 
3150:     /**
3151:      * This method will add an index to a type and field with name
3152:      * $name.
3153:      * This methods accepts a type and infers the corresponding table name.
3154:      *
3155:      * @param string $type   type to add index to
3156:      * @param string $name   name of the new index
3157:      * @param string $column field to index
3158:      *
3159:      * @return void
3160:      */
3161:     public function addIndex( $type, $name, $column );
3162: 
3163:     /**
3164:      * Checks and filters a database structure element like a table of column
3165:      * for safe use in a query. A database structure has to conform to the
3166:      * RedBeanPHP DB security policy which basically means only alphanumeric
3167:      * symbols are allowed. This security policy is more strict than conventional
3168:      * SQL policies and does therefore not require database specific escaping rules.
3169:      *
3170:      * @param string  $databaseStructure name of the column/table to check
3171:      * @param boolean $noQuotes          TRUE to NOT put backticks or quotes around the string
3172:      *
3173:      * @return string
3174:      */
3175:     public function esc( $databaseStructure, $dontQuote = FALSE );
3176: 
3177:     /**
3178:      * Removes all tables and views from the database.
3179:      *
3180:      * @return void
3181:      */
3182:     public function wipeAll();
3183: 
3184:     /**
3185:      * Renames an association. For instance if you would like to refer to
3186:      * album_song as: track you can specify this by calling this method like:
3187:      *
3188:      * renameAssociation('album_song','track')
3189:      *
3190:      * This allows:
3191:      *
3192:      * $album->sharedSong
3193:      *
3194:      * to add/retrieve beans from track instead of album_song.
3195:      * Also works for exportAll().
3196:      *
3197:      * This method also accepts a single associative array as
3198:      * its first argument.
3199:      *
3200:      * @param string|array $from
3201:      * @param string       $to (optional)
3202:      *
3203:      * @return void
3204:      */
3205:     public function renameAssocTable( $from, $to = NULL );
3206: 
3207:     /**
3208:      * Returns the format for link tables.
3209:      * Given an array containing two type names this method returns the
3210:      * name of the link table to be used to store and retrieve
3211:      * association records.
3212:      *
3213:      * @param  array $types two types array($type1, $type2)
3214:      *
3215:      * @return string
3216:      */
3217:     public function getAssocTable( $types );
3218: }
3219: }
3220: 
3221: namespace RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter {
3222: 
3223: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter\DBAdapter as DBAdapter;
3224: use RedBeanPHP\RedException as RedException;
3225: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter as QueryWriter;
3226: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
3227: 
3228: /**
3229:  * RedBean Abstract Query Writer
3230:  *
3231:  * @file    RedBean/QueryWriter/AQueryWriter.php
3232:  * @desc    Query Writer (abstract class)
3233:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
3234:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
3235:  *
3236:  * Represents an abstract Database to RedBean
3237:  * To write a driver for a different database for RedBean
3238:  * Contains a number of functions all implementors can
3239:  * inherit or override.
3240:  *
3241:  * (c) copyright G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
3242:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
3243:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
3244:  */
3245: abstract class AQueryWriter { //bracket must be here - otherwise coverage software does not understand.
3246:     /**
3247:      * @var DBAdapter
3248:      */
3249:     protected $adapter;
3250: 
3251:     /**
3252:      * @var string
3253:      */
3254:     protected $defaultValue = 'NULL';
3255: 
3256:     /**
3257:      * @var string
3258:      */
3259:     protected $quoteCharacter = '';
3260: 
3261:     /**
3262:      * @var boolean
3263:      */
3264:     protected $flagUseCache = TRUE;
3265: 
3266:     /**
3267:      * @var array
3268:      */
3269:     protected $cache = array();
3270: 
3271:     /**
3272:      * @var array
3273:      */
3274:     public static $renames = array();
3275: 
3276:     /**
3277:      * @var array
3278:      */
3279:     public $typeno_sqltype = array();
3280: 
3281:     /**
3282:      * Clears renames.
3283:      * 
3284:      * @return void
3285:      */
3286:     public static function clearRenames()
3287:     {
3288:         self::$renames = array();
3289:     }
3290:     
3291:     /**
3292:      * Generates a list of parameters (slots) for an SQL snippet.
3293:      * This method calculates the correct number of slots to insert in the
3294:      * SQL snippet and determines the correct type of slot. If the bindings
3295:      * array contains named parameters this method will return named ones and
3296:      * update the keys in the value list accordingly (that's why we use the &).
3297:      *
3298:      * If you pass an offset the bindings will be re-added to the value list.
3299:      * Some databases cant handle duplicate parameter names in queries.
3300:      *
3301:      * @param array   &$valueList     list of values to generate slots for (gets modified if needed)
3302:      * @param array   $otherBindings  list of additional bindings
3303:      * @param integer $offset         start counter at...
3304:      *
3305:      * @return string
3306:      */
3307:     protected function getParametersForInClause( &$valueList, $otherBindings, $offset = 0 )
3308:     {
3309:         if ( is_array( $otherBindings ) && count( $otherBindings ) > 0 ) {
3310:             reset( $otherBindings );
3311: 
3312:             $key = key( $otherBindings );
3313: 
3314:             if ( !is_numeric($key) ) {
3315:                 $filler  = array();
3316:                 $newList = (!$offset) ? array() : $valueList;
3317:                 $counter = $offset;
3318: 
3319:                 foreach( $valueList as $value ) {
3320:                     $slot           = ':slot' . ( $counter++ );
3321:                     $filler[]       = $slot;
3322:                     $newList[$slot] = $value;
3323:                 }
3324: 
3325:                 // Change the keys!
3326:                 $valueList = $newList;
3327: 
3328:                 return implode( ',', $filler );
3329:             }
3330:         }
3331: 
3332:         return implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $valueList ), '?' ) );
3333:     }
3334: 
3335:     /**
3336:      * Returns a cache key for the cache values passed.
3337:      * This method returns a fingerprint string to be used as a key to store
3338:      * data in the writer cache.
3339:      *
3340:      * @param array $keyValues key-value to generate key for
3341:      *
3342:      * @return string
3343:      */
3344:     private function getCacheKey( $keyValues )
3345:     {
3346:         return json_encode( $keyValues );
3347:     }
3348: 
3349:     /**
3350:      * Returns the values associated with the provided cache tag and key.
3351:      *
3352:      * @param string $cacheTag cache tag to use for lookup
3353:      * @param string $key      key to use for lookup
3354:      *
3355:      * @return mixed
3356:      */
3357:     private function getCached( $cacheTag, $key )
3358:     {
3359:         $sql = $this->adapter->getSQL();
3360:         
3361:         if ($this->updateCache()) {
3362:             if ( isset( $this->cache[$cacheTag][$key] ) ) {
3363:                 return $this->cache[$cacheTag][$key];
3364:             }
3365:         }
3366: 
3367:         return NULL;
3368:     }
3369: 
3370:     /**
3371:      * Checks if the previous query had a keep-cache tag.
3372:      * If so, the cache will persist, otherwise the cache will be flushed.
3373:      * 
3374:      * Returns TRUE if the cache will remain and FALSE if a flush has
3375:      * been performed.
3376:      * 
3377:      * @return boolean
3378:      */
3379:     private function updateCache()
3380:     {
3381:         $sql = $this->adapter->getSQL();
3382:         if ( strpos( $sql, '-- keep-cache' ) !== strlen( $sql ) - 13 ) {
3383:             // If SQL has been taken place outside of this method then something else then
3384:             // a select query might have happened! (or instruct to keep cache)
3385:             $this->cache = array();
3386:             return FALSE;
3387:         }
3388:         return TRUE;
3389:     }
3390:     
3391:     /**
3392:      * Stores data from the writer in the cache under a specific key and cache tag.
3393:      * A cache tag is used to make sure the cache remains consistent. In most cases the cache tag
3394:      * will be the bean type, this makes sure queries associated with a certain reference type will
3395:      * never contain conflicting data.
3396:      * You can only store one item under a cache tag. Why not use the cache tag as a key? Well
3397:      * we need to make sure the cache contents fits the key (and key is based on the cache values).
3398:      * Otherwise it would be possible to store two different result sets under the same key (the cache tag).
3399:      *
3400:      * @param string $cacheTag cache tag (secondary key)
3401:      * @param string $key      key
3402:      * @param array  $values   content to be stored
3403:      *
3404:      * @return void
3405:      */
3406:     private function putResultInCache( $cacheTag, $key, $values )
3407:     {
3408:         $this->cache[$cacheTag] = array(
3409:             $key => $values
3410:         );
3411:     }
3412: 
3413:     /**
3414:      * Creates an SQL snippet from a list of conditions of format:
3415:      *
3416:      * array(
3417:      *    key => array(
3418:      *           value1, value2, value3 ....
3419:      *        )
3420:      * )
3421:      *
3422:      * @param array  $conditions list of conditions
3423:      * @param array  $bindings   parameter bindings for SQL snippet
3424:      * @param string $addSql     SQL snippet
3425:      *
3426:      * @return string
3427:      */
3428:     private function makeSQLFromConditions( $conditions, &$bindings, $addSql = '' )
3429:     {
3430:         reset( $bindings );
3431:         $firstKey       = key( $bindings );
3432:         $paramTypeIsNum = ( is_numeric( $firstKey ) );
3433:         $counter        = 0;
3434: 
3435:         $sqlConditions = array();
3436:         foreach ( $conditions as $column => $values ) {
3437:             if ( !count( $values ) ) continue;
3438: 
3439:             $sql = $this->esc( $column );
3440:             $sql .= ' IN ( ';
3441: 
3442:             if ( !is_array( $values ) ) $values = array( $values );
3443: 
3444:             // If it's safe to skip bindings, do so...
3445:             if ( ctype_digit( implode( '', $values ) ) ) {
3446:                 $sql .= implode( ',', $values ) . ' ) ';
3447: 
3448:                 // only numeric, cant do much harm
3449:                 $sqlConditions[] = $sql;
3450:             } else {
3451: 
3452:                 if ( $paramTypeIsNum ) {
3453:                     $sql .= implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $values ), '?' ) ) . ' ) ';
3454: 
3455:                     array_unshift($sqlConditions, $sql);
3456: 
3457:                     foreach ( $values as $k => $v ) {
3458:                         $values[$k] = strval( $v );
3459: 
3460:                         array_unshift( $bindings, $v );
3461:                     }
3462:                 } else {
3463: 
3464:                     $slots = array();
3465: 
3466:                     foreach( $values as $k => $v ) {
3467:                         $slot            = ':slot'.$counter++;
3468:                         $slots[]         = $slot;
3469:                         $bindings[$slot] = strval( $v );
3470:                     }
3471: 
3472:                     $sql .= implode( ',', $slots ).' ) ';
3473:                     $sqlConditions[] = $sql;
3474:                 }
3475:             }
3476:         }
3477: 
3478:         $sql = '';
3479:         if ( is_array( $sqlConditions ) && count( $sqlConditions ) > 0 ) {
3480:             $sql = implode( ' AND ', $sqlConditions );
3481:             $sql = " WHERE ( $sql ) ";
3482: 
3483:             if ( $addSql ) $sql .= $addSql;
3484:         } elseif ( $addSql ) {
3485:             $sql = $addSql;
3486:         }
3487: 
3488:         return $sql;
3489:     }
3490: 
3491:     /**
3492:      * Returns the table names and column names for a relational query.
3493:      *
3494:      * @param string  $sourceType type of the source bean
3495:      * @param string  $destType   type of the bean you want to obtain using the relation
3496:      * @param boolean $noQuote    TRUE if you want to omit quotes
3497:      *
3498:      * @return array
3499:      */
3500:     private function getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType, $noQuote = FALSE )
3501:     {
3502:         $linkTable   = $this->esc( $this->getAssocTable( array( $sourceType, $destType ) ), $noQuote );
3503:         $sourceCol   = $this->esc( $sourceType . '_id', $noQuote );
3504: 
3505:         if ( $sourceType === $destType ) {
3506:             $destCol = $this->esc( $destType . '2_id', $noQuote );
3507:         } else {
3508:             $destCol = $this->esc( $destType . '_id', $noQuote );
3509:         }
3510: 
3511:         $sourceTable = $this->esc( $sourceType, $noQuote );
3512:         $destTable   = $this->esc( $destType, $noQuote );
3513: 
3514:         return array( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol );
3515:     }
3516: 
3517:     /**
3518:      * Adds a data type to the list of data types.
3519:      * Use this method to add a new column type definition to the writer.
3520:      * Used for UUID support.
3521:      *
3522:      * @param integer $dataTypeID    magic number constant assigned to this data type
3523:      * @param string  $SQLDefinition SQL column definition (i.e. INT(11))
3524:      *
3525:      * @return self
3526:      */
3527:     protected function addDataType( $dataTypeID, $SQLDefinition )
3528:     {
3529:         $this->typeno_sqltype[ $dataTypeID ] = $SQLDefinition;
3530:         $this->sqltype_typeno[ $SQLDefinition ] = $dataTypeID;
3531:         return $this;
3532:     }
3533: 
3534:     /**
3535:      * Returns the sql that should follow an insert statement.
3536:      *
3537:      * @param string $table name
3538:      *
3539:      * @return string
3540:      */
3541:     protected function getInsertSuffix( $table )
3542:     {
3543:         return '';
3544:     }
3545: 
3546:     /**
3547:      * Checks whether a value starts with zeros. In this case
3548:      * the value should probably be stored using a text datatype instead of a
3549:      * numerical type in order to preserve the zeros.
3550:      *
3551:      * @param string $value value to be checked.
3552:      *
3553:      * @return boolean
3554:      */
3555:     protected function startsWithZeros( $value )
3556:     {
3557:         $value = strval( $value );
3558: 
3559:         if ( strlen( $value ) > 1 && strpos( $value, '0' ) === 0 && strpos( $value, '0.' ) !== 0 ) {
3560:             return TRUE;
3561:         } else {
3562:             return FALSE;
3563:         }
3564:     }
3565: 
3566:     /**
3567:      * Inserts a record into the database using a series of insert columns
3568:      * and corresponding insertvalues. Returns the insert id.
3569:      *
3570:      * @param string $table         table to perform query on
3571:      * @param array  $insertcolumns columns to be inserted
3572:      * @param array  $insertvalues  values to be inserted
3573:      *
3574:      * @return integer
3575:      */
3576:     protected function insertRecord( $type, $insertcolumns, $insertvalues )
3577:     {
3578:         $default = $this->defaultValue;
3579:         $suffix  = $this->getInsertSuffix( $type );
3580:         $table   = $this->esc( $type );
3581: 
3582:         if ( count( $insertvalues ) > 0 && is_array( $insertvalues[0] ) && count( $insertvalues[0] ) > 0 ) {
3583:             foreach ( $insertcolumns as $k => $v ) {
3584:                 $insertcolumns[$k] = $this->esc( $v );
3585:             }
3586: 
3587:             $insertSQL = "INSERT INTO $table ( id, " . implode( ',', $insertcolumns ) . " ) VALUES
3588:             ( $default, " . implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $insertcolumns ), ' ? ' ) ) . " ) $suffix";
3589: 
3590:             $ids = array();
3591:             foreach ( $insertvalues as $i => $insertvalue ) {
3592:                 $ids[] = $this->adapter->getCell( $insertSQL, $insertvalue, $i );
3593:             }
3594: 
3595:             $result = count( $ids ) === 1 ? array_pop( $ids ) : $ids;
3596:         } else {
3597:             $result = $this->adapter->getCell( "INSERT INTO $table (id) VALUES($default) $suffix" );
3598:         }
3599: 
3600:         if ( $suffix ) return $result;
3601: 
3602:         $last_id = $this->adapter->getInsertID();
3603: 
3604:         return $last_id;
3605:     }
3606: 
3607:     /**
3608:      * Checks table name or column name.
3609:      *
3610:      * @param string $table table string
3611:      *
3612:      * @return string
3613:      *
3614:      * @throws Security
3615:      */
3616:     protected function check( $struct )
3617:     {
3618:         if ( !preg_match( '/^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$/', $struct ) ) {
3619:             throw new RedException( 'Identifier does not conform to RedBeanPHP security policies.' );
3620:         }
3621: 
3622:         return $struct;
3623:     }
3624: 
3625:     /**
3626:      * Checks whether a number can be treated like an int.
3627:      *
3628:      * @param  string $value string representation of a certain value
3629:      *
3630:      * @return boolean
3631:      */
3632:     public static function canBeTreatedAsInt( $value )
3633:     {
3634:         return (bool) ( ctype_digit( strval( $value ) ) && strval( $value ) === strval( intval( $value ) ) );
3635:     }
3636: 
3637:     /**
3638:      * @see QueryWriter::getAssocTableFormat
3639:      */
3640:     public static function getAssocTableFormat( $types )
3641:     {
3642:         sort( $types );
3643: 
3644:         $assoc = implode( '_', $types );
3645: 
3646:         return ( isset( self::$renames[$assoc] ) ) ? self::$renames[$assoc] : $assoc;
3647:     }
3648: 
3649:     /**
3650:      * @see QueryWriter::renameAssociation
3651:      */
3652:     public static function renameAssociation( $from, $to = NULL )
3653:     {
3654:         if ( is_array( $from ) ) {
3655:             foreach ( $from as $key => $value ) self::$renames[$key] = $value;
3656: 
3657:             return;
3658:         }
3659: 
3660:         self::$renames[$from] = $to;
3661:     }
3662:     
3663:     /**
3664:      * Globally available service method for RedBeanPHP.
3665:      * Converts a camel cased string to a snake cased string.
3666:      * 
3667:      * @param string $camel a camelCased string
3668:      * 
3669:      * @return string
3670:      */
3671:     public static function camelsSnake( $camel )
3672:     {
3673:         return strtolower( preg_replace( '/(?<=[a-z])([A-Z])|([A-Z])(?=[a-z])/', '_$1$2', $camel ) );
3674:     }
3675: 
3676:     /**
3677:      * Checks whether the specified type (i.e. table) already exists in the database.
3678:      * Not part of the Object Database interface!
3679:      *
3680:      * @param string $table table name
3681:      *
3682:      * @return boolean
3683:      */
3684:     public function tableExists( $table )
3685:     {
3686:         $tables = $this->getTables();
3687: 
3688:         return in_array( $table, $tables );
3689:     }
3690: 
3691:     /**
3692:      * @see QueryWriter::glueSQLCondition
3693:      */
3694:     public function glueSQLCondition( $sql, $glue = NULL )
3695:     {
3696:         static $snippetCache = array();
3697: 
3698:         if ( trim( $sql ) === '' ) {
3699:             return $sql;
3700:         }
3701: 
3702:         $key = $glue . '|' . $sql;
3703: 
3704:         if ( isset( $snippetCache[$key] ) ) {
3705:             return $snippetCache[$key];
3706:         }
3707: 
3708:         $lsql = ltrim( $sql );
3709: 
3710:         if ( preg_match( '/^(INNER|LEFT|RIGHT|JOIN|AND|OR|WHERE|ORDER|GROUP|HAVING|LIMIT|OFFSET)\s+/i', $lsql ) ) {
3711:             if ( $glue === QueryWriter::C_GLUE_WHERE && stripos( $lsql, 'AND' ) === 0 ) {
3712:                 $snippetCache[$key] = ' WHERE ' . substr( $lsql, 3 );
3713:             } else {
3714:                 $snippetCache[$key] = $sql;
3715:             }
3716:         } else {
3717:             $snippetCache[$key] = ( ( $glue === QueryWriter::C_GLUE_AND ) ? ' AND ' : ' WHERE ') . $sql;
3718:         }
3719: 
3720:         return $snippetCache[$key];
3721:     }
3722: 
3723:     /**
3724:      * @see QueryWriter::esc
3725:      */
3726:     public function esc( $dbStructure, $dontQuote = FALSE )
3727:     {
3728:         $this->check( $dbStructure );
3729: 
3730:         return ( $dontQuote ) ? $dbStructure : $this->quoteCharacter . $dbStructure . $this->quoteCharacter;
3731:     }
3732: 
3733:     /**
3734:      * @see QueryWriter::addColumn
3735:      */
3736:     public function addColumn( $type, $column, $field )
3737:     {
3738:         $table  = $type;
3739:         $type   = $field;
3740:         $table  = $this->esc( $table );
3741:         $column = $this->esc( $column );
3742: 
3743:         $type = ( isset( $this->typeno_sqltype[$type] ) ) ? $this->typeno_sqltype[$type] : '';
3744: 
3745:         $this->adapter->exec( "ALTER TABLE $table ADD $column $type " );
3746:     }
3747: 
3748:     /**
3749:      * @see QueryWriter::updateRecord
3750:      */
3751:     public function updateRecord( $type, $updatevalues, $id = NULL )
3752:     {
3753:         $table = $type;
3754:         
3755:         if ( !$id ) {
3756:             $insertcolumns = $insertvalues = array();
3757: 
3758:             foreach ( $updatevalues as $pair ) {
3759:                 $insertcolumns[] = $pair['property'];
3760:                 $insertvalues[]  = $pair['value'];
3761:             }
3762: 
3763:             //Otherwise psql returns string while MySQL/SQLite return numeric causing problems with additions (array_diff)
3764:             return (string) $this->insertRecord( $table, $insertcolumns, array( $insertvalues ) );
3765:         }
3766: 
3767:         if ( $id && !count( $updatevalues ) ) {
3768:             return $id;
3769:         }
3770: 
3771:         $table = $this->esc( $table );
3772:         $sql   = "UPDATE $table SET ";
3773: 
3774:         $p = $v = array();
3775: 
3776:         foreach ( $updatevalues as $uv ) {
3777:             $p[] = " {$this->esc( $uv["property"] )} = ? ";
3778:             $v[] = $uv['value'];
3779:         }
3780: 
3781:         $sql .= implode( ',', $p ) . ' WHERE id = ? ';
3782: 
3783:         $v[] = $id;
3784: 
3785:         $this->adapter->exec( $sql, $v );
3786: 
3787:         return $id;
3788:     }
3789: 
3790:     /**
3791:      * @see QueryWriter::queryRecord
3792:      */
3793:     public function queryRecord( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
3794:     {
3795:         $addSql = $this->glueSQLCondition( $addSql, ( count($conditions) > 0) ? QueryWriter::C_GLUE_AND : NULL );
3796: 
3797:         $key = NULL;
3798:         if ( $this->flagUseCache ) {
3799:             $key = $this->getCacheKey( array( $conditions, $addSql, $bindings, 'select' ) );
3800:             
3801:             if ( $cached = $this->getCached( $type, $key ) ) {
3802:                 return $cached;
3803:             }
3804:         }
3805: 
3806:         $table = $this->esc( $type );
3807: 
3808:         $sql   = $this->makeSQLFromConditions( $conditions, $bindings, $addSql );
3809:         $sql   = "SELECT * FROM {$table} {$sql} -- keep-cache";
3810: 
3811:         $rows  = $this->adapter->get( $sql, $bindings );
3812: 
3813:         if ( $this->flagUseCache && $key ) {
3814:             $this->putResultInCache( $type, $key, $rows );
3815:         }
3816: 
3817:         return $rows;
3818:     }
3819: 
3820:     /**
3821:      * @see QueryWriter::queryRecordRelated
3822:      */
3823:     public function queryRecordRelated( $sourceType, $destType, $linkIDs, $addSql = '', $bindings = array() )
3824:     {
3825:         $addSql = $this->glueSQLCondition( $addSql, QueryWriter::C_GLUE_WHERE );
3826: 
3827:         list( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol ) = $this->getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType );
3828: 
3829:         $key = $this->getCacheKey( array( $sourceType, $destType, implode( ',', $linkIDs ), $addSql, $bindings ) );
3830: 
3831:         if ( $this->flagUseCache && $cached = $this->getCached( $destType, $key ) ) {
3832:             return $cached;
3833:         }
3834: 
3835:         $inClause = $this->getParametersForInClause( $linkIDs, $bindings );
3836: 
3837:         if ( $sourceType === $destType ) {
3838:             $inClause2 = $this->getParametersForInClause( $linkIDs, $bindings, count( $bindings ) ); //for some databases
3839:             $sql = "
3840:             SELECT
3841:                 {$destTable}.*,
3842:                 COALESCE(
3843:                 NULLIF({$linkTable}.{$sourceCol}, {$destTable}.id),
3844:                 NULLIF({$linkTable}.{$destCol}, {$destTable}.id)) AS linked_by
3845:             FROM {$linkTable}
3846:             INNER JOIN {$destTable} ON
3847:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$destCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} IN ($inClause) ) OR
3848:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$destCol} IN ($inClause2) )
3849:             {$addSql}
3850:             -- keep-cache";
3851: 
3852:             $linkIDs = array_merge( $linkIDs, $linkIDs );
3853:         } else {
3854:             $sql = "
3855:             SELECT
3856:                 {$destTable}.*,
3857:                 {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} AS linked_by
3858:             FROM {$linkTable}
3859:             INNER JOIN {$destTable} ON
3860:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$destCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} IN ($inClause) )
3861:             {$addSql}
3862:             -- keep-cache";
3863:         }
3864: 
3865:         $bindings = array_merge( $linkIDs, $bindings );
3866: 
3867:         $rows = $this->adapter->get( $sql, $bindings );
3868: 
3869:         $this->putResultInCache( $destType, $key, $rows );
3870: 
3871:         return $rows;
3872:     }
3873: 
3874:     /**
3875:      * @see QueryWriter::queryRecordLink
3876:      */
3877:     public function queryRecordLink( $sourceType, $destType, $sourceID, $destID )
3878:     {
3879:         list( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol ) = $this->getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType );
3880: 
3881:         $key = $this->getCacheKey( array( $sourceType, $destType, $sourceID, $destID ) );
3882: 
3883:         if ( $this->flagUseCache && $cached = $this->getCached( $linkTable, $key ) ) {
3884:             return $cached;
3885:         }
3886: 
3887:         if ( $sourceTable === $destTable ) {
3888:             $sql = "SELECT {$linkTable}.* FROM {$linkTable}
3889:                 WHERE ( {$sourceCol} = ? AND {$destCol} = ? ) OR
3890:                  ( {$destCol} = ? AND {$sourceCol} = ? ) -- keep-cache";
3891:             $row = $this->adapter->getRow( $sql, array( $sourceID, $destID, $sourceID, $destID ) );
3892:         } else {
3893:             $sql = "SELECT {$linkTable}.* FROM {$linkTable}
3894:                 WHERE {$sourceCol} = ? AND {$destCol} = ? -- keep-cache";
3895:             $row = $this->adapter->getRow( $sql, array( $sourceID, $destID ) );
3896:         }
3897: 
3898:         $this->putResultInCache( $linkTable, $key, $row );
3899: 
3900:         return $row;
3901:     }
3902: 
3903:     /**
3904:      * @see QueryWriter::queryRecordCount
3905:      */
3906:     public function queryRecordCount( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
3907:     {
3908:         $addSql = $this->glueSQLCondition( $addSql );
3909: 
3910:         $table  = $this->esc( $type );
3911:         
3912:         $this->updateCache(); //check if cache chain has been broken
3913: 
3914:         $sql    = $this->makeSQLFromConditions( $conditions, $bindings, $addSql );
3915:         $sql    = "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM {$table} {$sql} -- keep-cache";
3916: 
3917:         return (int) $this->adapter->getCell( $sql, $bindings );
3918:     }
3919: 
3920:     /**
3921:      * @see QueryWriter::queryRecordCountRelated
3922:      */
3923:     public function queryRecordCountRelated( $sourceType, $destType, $linkID, $addSql = '', $bindings = array() )
3924:     {
3925:         list( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol ) = $this->getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType );
3926: 
3927:         $this->updateCache(); //check if cache chain has been broken
3928: 
3929:         if ( $sourceType === $destType ) {
3930:             $sql = "
3931:             SELECT COUNT(*) FROM {$linkTable}
3932:             INNER JOIN {$destTable} ON
3933:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$destCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} = ? ) OR
3934:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$destCol} = ? )
3935:             {$addSql}
3936:             -- keep-cache";
3937: 
3938:             $bindings = array_merge( array( $linkID, $linkID ), $bindings );
3939:         } else {
3940:             $sql = "
3941:             SELECT COUNT(*) FROM {$linkTable}
3942:             INNER JOIN {$destTable} ON
3943:             ( {$destTable}.id = {$linkTable}.{$destCol} AND {$linkTable}.{$sourceCol} = ? )
3944:             {$addSql}
3945:             -- keep-cache";
3946: 
3947:             $bindings = array_merge( array( $linkID ), $bindings );
3948:         }
3949: 
3950:         return (int) $this->adapter->getCell( $sql, $bindings );
3951:     }
3952: 
3953:     /**
3954:      * @see QueryWriter::deleteRecord
3955:      */
3956:     public function deleteRecord( $type, $conditions = array(), $addSql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
3957:     {
3958:         $addSql = $this->glueSQLCondition( $addSql );
3959: 
3960:         $table  = $this->esc( $type );
3961: 
3962:         $sql    = $this->makeSQLFromConditions( $conditions, $bindings, $addSql );
3963:         $sql    = "DELETE FROM {$table} {$sql}";
3964: 
3965:         $this->adapter->exec( $sql, $bindings );
3966:     }
3967: 
3968:     /**
3969:      * @see QueryWriter::deleteRelations
3970:      */
3971:     public function deleteRelations( $sourceType, $destType, $sourceID )
3972:     {
3973:         list( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol ) = $this->getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType );
3974: 
3975:         if ( $sourceTable === $destTable ) {
3976:             $sql = "DELETE FROM {$linkTable}
3977:                 WHERE ( {$sourceCol} = ? ) OR
3978:                 ( {$destCol} = ?  )
3979:             ";
3980: 
3981:             $this->adapter->exec( $sql, array( $sourceID, $sourceID ) );
3982:         } else {
3983:             $sql = "DELETE FROM {$linkTable}
3984:                 WHERE {$sourceCol} = ? ";
3985: 
3986:             $this->adapter->exec( $sql, array( $sourceID ) );
3987:         }
3988:     }
3989: 
3990:     /**
3991:      * @see QueryWriter::widenColumn
3992:      */
3993:     public function widenColumn( $type, $column, $datatype )
3994:     {
3995:         if ( !isset($this->typeno_sqltype[$datatype]) ) return;
3996: 
3997:         $table   = $type;
3998:         $type    = $datatype;
3999: 
4000:         $table   = $this->esc( $table );
4001:         $column  = $this->esc( $column );
4002: 
4003:         $newtype = $this->typeno_sqltype[$type];
4004: 
4005:         $this->adapter->exec( "ALTER TABLE $table CHANGE $column $column $newtype " );
4006:     }
4007: 
4008:     /**
4009:      * @see QueryWriter::wipe
4010:      */
4011:     public function wipe( $type )
4012:     {
4013:         $table = $this->esc( $type );
4014: 
4015:         $this->adapter->exec( "TRUNCATE $table " );
4016:     }
4017: 
4018:     /**
4019:      * @see QueryWriter::renameAssocTable
4020:      */
4021:     public function renameAssocTable( $from, $to = NULL )
4022:     {
4023:         self::renameAssociation( $from, $to );
4024:     }
4025: 
4026:     /**
4027:      * @see QueryWriter::getAssocTable
4028:      */
4029:     public function getAssocTable( $types )
4030:     {
4031:         return self::getAssocTableFormat( $types );
4032:     }
4033: 
4034:     /**
4035:      * @see QueryWriter::addConstraintForTypes
4036:      */
4037:     public function addConstraintForTypes( $sourceType, $destType )
4038:     {
4039:         list( $sourceTable, $destTable, $linkTable, $sourceCol, $destCol ) = $this->getRelationalTablesAndColumns( $sourceType, $destType, TRUE );
4040: 
4041:         return $this->constrain( $linkTable, $sourceTable, $destTable, $sourceCol, $destCol );
4042:     }
4043: 
4044:     /**
4045:      * Turns caching on or off. Default: off.
4046:      * If caching is turned on retrieval queries fired after eachother will
4047:      * use a result row cache.
4048:      *
4049:      * @param boolean
4050:      */
4051:     public function setUseCache( $yesNo )
4052:     {
4053:         $this->flushCache();
4054: 
4055:         $this->flagUseCache = (bool) $yesNo;
4056:     }
4057: 
4058:     /**
4059:      * Flushes the Query Writer Cache.
4060:      *
4061:      * @return void
4062:      */
4063:     public function flushCache()
4064:     {
4065:         $this->cache = array();
4066:     }
4067: 
4068:     /**
4069:      * @deprecated Use esc() instead.
4070:      *
4071:      * @param string  $column   column to be escaped
4072:      * @param boolean $noQuotes omit quotes
4073:      *
4074:      * @return string
4075:      */
4076:     public function safeColumn( $column, $noQuotes = FALSE )
4077:     {
4078:         return $this->esc( $column, $noQuotes );
4079:     }
4080: 
4081:     /**
4082:      * @deprecated Use esc() instead.
4083:      *
4084:      * @param string  $table    table to be escaped
4085:      * @param boolean $noQuotes omit quotes
4086:      *
4087:      * @return string
4088:      */
4089:     public function safeTable( $table, $noQuotes = FALSE )
4090:     {
4091:         return $this->esc( $table, $noQuotes );
4092:     }
4093: }
4094: } 
4095: 
4096: namespace RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter {
4097: 
4098: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter\AQueryWriter as AQueryWriter;
4099: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter as QueryWriter;
4100: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter\DBAdapter as DBAdapter;
4101: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter as Adapter;
4102: 
4103: /**
4104:  * RedBean MySQLWriter
4105:  *
4106:  * @file    RedBean/QueryWriter/MySQL.php
4107:  * @desc    Represents a MySQL Database to RedBean
4108:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
4109:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
4110:  *
4111:  * (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
4112:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
4113:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
4114:  */
4115: class MySQL extends AQueryWriter implements QueryWriter
4116: {
4117: 
4118:     /**
4119:      * Data types
4120:      */
4121:     const C_DATATYPE_BOOL             = 0;
4122:     const C_DATATYPE_UINT32           = 2;
4123:     const C_DATATYPE_DOUBLE           = 3;
4124:     const C_DATATYPE_TEXT8            = 4;
4125:     const C_DATATYPE_TEXT16           = 5;
4126:     const C_DATATYPE_TEXT32           = 6;
4127:     const C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATE     = 80;
4128:     const C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATETIME = 81;
4129:     const C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_POINT    = 90;
4130:     const C_DATATYPE_SPECIFIED        = 99;
4131: 
4132:     /**
4133:      * @var DBAdapter
4134:      */
4135:     protected $adapter;
4136: 
4137:     /**
4138:      * @var string
4139:      */
4140:     protected $quoteCharacter = '`';
4141: 
4142:     /**
4143:      * Add the constraints for a specific database driver: MySQL.
4144:      *
4145:      * @param string $table     table     table to add constrains to
4146:      * @param string $table1    table1    first reference table
4147:      * @param string $table2    table2    second reference table
4148:      * @param string $property1 property1 first column
4149:      * @param string $property2 property2 second column
4150:      *
4151:      * @return boolean $succes whether the constraint has been applied
4152:      */
4153:     protected function constrain( $table, $table1, $table2, $property1, $property2 )
4154:     {
4155:         try {
4156:             $db  = $this->adapter->getCell( 'SELECT database()' );
4157: 
4158:             $fks = $this->adapter->getCell(
4159:                 "SELECT count(*)
4160:                 FROM information_schema.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE
4161:                 WHERE TABLE_SCHEMA = ? AND TABLE_NAME = ? AND
4162:                 CONSTRAINT_NAME <>'PRIMARY' AND REFERENCED_TABLE_NAME IS NOT NULL",
4163:                 array( $db, $table )
4164:             );
4165: 
4166:             // already foreign keys added in this association table
4167:             if ( $fks > 0 ) {
4168:                 return FALSE;
4169:             }
4170: 
4171:             $columns = $this->getColumns( $table );
4172: 
4173:             $idType = $this->getTypeForID();
4174: 
4175:             if ( $this->code( $columns[$property1] ) !==  $idType ) {
4176:                 $this->widenColumn( $table, $property1, $idType );
4177:             }
4178: 
4179:             if ( $this->code( $columns[$property2] ) !== $idType ) {
4180:                 $this->widenColumn( $table, $property2, $idType );
4181:             }
4182: 
4183:             $sql = "
4184:                 ALTER TABLE " . $this->esc( $table ) . "
4185:                 ADD FOREIGN KEY($property1) references `$table1`(id) ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE;
4186:             ";
4187: 
4188:             $this->adapter->exec( $sql );
4189: 
4190:             $sql = "
4191:                 ALTER TABLE " . $this->esc( $table ) . "
4192:                 ADD FOREIGN KEY($property2) references `$table2`(id) ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE
4193:             ";
4194: 
4195:             $this->adapter->exec( $sql );
4196: 
4197:             return TRUE;
4198:         } catch ( \Exception $e ) {
4199:             return FALSE;
4200:         }
4201:     }
4202: 
4203:     /**
4204:      * Constructor
4205:      *
4206:      * @param Adapter $adapter Database Adapter
4207:      */
4208:     public function __construct( Adapter $adapter )
4209:     {
4210:         $this->typeno_sqltype = array(
4211:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_BOOL             => ' TINYINT(1) UNSIGNED ',
4212:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_UINT32           => ' INT(11) UNSIGNED ',
4213:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_DOUBLE           => ' DOUBLE ',
4214:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT8            => ' VARCHAR(255) ',
4215:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT16           => ' TEXT ',
4216:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT32           => ' LONGTEXT ',
4217:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATE     => ' DATE ',
4218:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATETIME => ' DATETIME ',
4219:             MySQL::C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_POINT    => ' POINT ',
4220:         );
4221: 
4222:         $this->sqltype_typeno = array();
4223: 
4224:         foreach ( $this->typeno_sqltype as $k => $v ) {
4225:             $this->sqltype_typeno[trim( strtolower( $v ) )] = $k;
4226:         }
4227: 
4228:         $this->adapter = $adapter;
4229: 
4230:         $this->encoding = $this->adapter->getDatabase()->getMysqlEncoding();
4231:     }
4232: 
4233:     /**
4234:      * This method returns the datatype to be used for primary key IDS and
4235:      * foreign keys. Returns one if the data type constants.
4236:      *
4237:      * @return integer $const data type to be used for IDS.
4238:      */
4239:     public function getTypeForID()
4240:     {
4241:         return self::C_DATATYPE_UINT32;
4242:     }
4243: 
4244:     /**
4245:      * @see QueryWriter::getTables
4246:      */
4247:     public function getTables()
4248:     {
4249:         return $this->adapter->getCol( 'show tables' );
4250:     }
4251: 
4252:     /**
4253:      * @see QueryWriter::createTable
4254:      */
4255:     public function createTable( $table )
4256:     {
4257:         $table = $this->esc( $table );
4258: 
4259:         $encoding = $this->adapter->getDatabase()->getMysqlEncoding();
4260:         $sql   = "CREATE TABLE $table (id INT( 11 ) UNSIGNED NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, PRIMARY KEY ( id )) ENGINE = InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET={$encoding} COLLATE={$encoding}_unicode_ci ";
4261: 
4262:         $this->adapter->exec( $sql );
4263:     }
4264: 
4265:     /**
4266:      * @see QueryWriter::getColumns
4267:      */
4268:     public function getColumns( $table )
4269:     {
4270:         $columnsRaw = $this->adapter->get( "DESCRIBE " . $this->esc( $table ) );
4271: 
4272:         $columns = array();
4273:         foreach ( $columnsRaw as $r ) {
4274:             $columns[$r['Field']] = $r['Type'];
4275:         }
4276: 
4277:         return $columns;
4278:     }
4279: 
4280:     /**
4281:      * @see QueryWriter::scanType
4282:      */
4283:     public function scanType( $value, $flagSpecial = FALSE )
4284:     {
4285:         $this->svalue = $value;
4286: 
4287:         if ( is_null( $value ) ) return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_BOOL;
4288: 
4289:         if ( $flagSpecial ) {
4290:             if ( preg_match( '/^\d{4}\-\d\d-\d\d$/', $value ) ) {
4291:                 return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATE;
4292:             }
4293:             if ( preg_match( '/^\d{4}\-\d\d-\d\d\s\d\d:\d\d:\d\d$/', $value ) ) {
4294:                 return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_SPECIAL_DATETIME;
4295:             }
4296:         }
4297: 
4298:         $value = strval( $value );
4299: 
4300:         if ( !$this->startsWithZeros( $value ) ) {
4301:             
4302:             if ( $value === TRUE || $value === FALSE || $value === '1' || $value === '' || $value === '0') {
4303:                 return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_BOOL;
4304:             }
4305: 
4306:             if ( is_numeric( $value ) && ( floor( $value ) == $value ) && $value >= 0 && $value <= 4294967295 ) {
4307:                 return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_UINT32;
4308:             }
4309: 
4310:             if ( is_numeric( $value ) ) {
4311:                 return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_DOUBLE;
4312:             }
4313:         }
4314: 
4315:         if ( mb_strlen( $value, 'UTF-8' ) <= 255 ) {
4316:             return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT8;
4317:         }
4318: 
4319:         if ( mb_strlen( $value, 'UTF-8' ) <= 65535 ) {
4320:             return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT16;
4321:         }
4322: 
4323:         return MySQL::C_DATATYPE_TEXT32;
4324:     }
4325: 
4326:     /**
4327:      * @see QueryWriter::code
4328:      */
4329:     public function code( $typedescription, $includeSpecials = FALSE )
4330:     {
4331:         if ( isset( $this->sqltype_typeno[$typedescription] ) ) {
4332:             $r = $this->sqltype_typeno[$typedescription];
4333:         } else {
4334:             $r = self::C_DATATYPE_SPECIFIED;
4335:         }
4336: 
4337:         if ( $includeSpecials ) {
4338:             return $r;
4339:         }
4340: 
4341:         if ( $r >= QueryWriter::C_DATATYPE_RANGE_SPECIAL ) {
4342:             return self::C_DATATYPE_SPECIFIED;
4343:         }
4344: 
4345:         return $r;
4346:     }
4347: 
4348:     /**
4349:      * @see QueryWriter::addUniqueIndex
4350:      */
4351:     public function addUniqueIndex( $table, $columns )
4352:     {
4353:         $table = $this->esc( $table );
4354: 
4355:         sort( $columns ); // Else we get multiple indexes due to order-effects
4356: 
4357:         foreach ( $columns as $k => $v ) {
4358:             $columns[$k] = $this->esc( $v );
4359:         }
4360: 
4361:         $r    = $this->adapter->get( "SHOW INDEX FROM $table" );
4362: 
4363:         $name = 'UQ_' . sha1( implode( ',', $columns ) );
4364: 
4365:         if ( $r ) {
4366:             foreach ( $r as $i ) {
4367:                 if ( $i['Key_name'] == $name ) {
4368:                     return;
4369:                 }
4370:             }
4371:         }
4372: 
4373:         try {
4374:             $sql = "ALTER TABLE $table
4375:                          ADD UNIQUE INDEX $name (" . implode( ',', $columns ) . ")";
4376:         } catch ( \Exception $e ) {
4377:             //do nothing, dont use alter table ignore, this will delete duplicate records in 3-ways!
4378:         }
4379:             
4380:         $this->adapter->exec( $sql );
4381:     }
4382: 
4383:     /**
4384:      * @see QueryWriter::addIndex
4385:      */
4386:     public function addIndex( $type, $name, $column )
4387:     {
4388:         $table  = $type;
4389:         $table  = $this->esc( $table );
4390: 
4391:         $name   = preg_replace( '/\W/', '', $name );
4392: 
4393:         $column = $this->esc( $column );
4394: 
4395:         try {
4396:             foreach ( $this->adapter->get( "SHOW INDEX FROM $table " ) as $ind ) if ( $ind['Key_name'] === $name ) return;
4397:             $this->adapter->exec( "CREATE INDEX $name ON $table ($column) " );
4398:         } catch (\Exception $e ) {
4399:         }
4400:     }
4401:     
4402:     /**
4403:      * @see QueryWriter::addFK
4404:      */
4405:     public function addFK( $type, $targetType, $field, $targetField, $isDependent = FALSE )
4406:     {
4407:         
4408:         $db = $this->adapter->getCell( 'SELECT DATABASE()' );
4409:         
4410:         $cfks = $this->adapter->getCell('
4411:             SELECT CONSTRAINT_NAME
4412:                 FROM information_schema.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE
4413:             WHERE 
4414:                 TABLE_SCHEMA = ? 
4415:                 AND TABLE_NAME = ? 
4416:                 AND COLUMN_NAME = ? AND
4417:                 CONSTRAINT_NAME != \'PRIMARY\'
4418:                 AND REFERENCED_TABLE_NAME IS NOT NULL
4419:         ', array($db, $type, $field));
4420: 
4421:         if ($cfks) return;
4422:         
4423:         try {       
4424:             $fkName = 'fk_'.($type.'_'.$field);
4425:             $cName = 'c_'.$fkName;
4426:             $this->adapter->exec( "
4427:                 ALTER TABLE  {$this->esc($type)}
4428:                 ADD CONSTRAINT $cName 
4429:                 FOREIGN KEY $fkName ( {$this->esc($field)} ) REFERENCES {$this->esc($targetType)} (
4430:                 {$this->esc($targetField)}) ON DELETE " . ( $isDependent ? 'CASCADE' : 'SET NULL' ) . ' ON UPDATE '.( $isDependent ? 'CASCADE' : 'SET NULL' ).';');
4431:             
4432:         } catch (\Exception $e ) {
4433:             // Failure of fk-constraints is not a problem
4434:         }
4435:     }
4436: 
4437:     /**
4438:      * @see QueryWriter::sqlStateIn
4439:      */
4440:     public function sqlStateIn( $state, $list )
4441:     {
4442:         $stateMap = array(
4443:             '42S02' => QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_TABLE,
4444:             '42S22' => QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_COLUMN,
4445:             '23000' => QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_INTEGRITY_CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION
4446:         );
4447: 
4448:         return in_array( ( isset( $stateMap[$state] ) ? $stateMap[$state] : '0' ), $list );
4449:     }
4450: 
4451:     /**
4452:      * @see QueryWriter::wipeAll
4453:      */
4454:     public function wipeAll()
4455:     {
4456:         $this->adapter->exec( 'SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS = 0;' );
4457: 
4458:         foreach ( $this->getTables() as $t ) {
4459:             try {
4460:                 $this->adapter->exec( "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `$t`" );
4461:             } catch (\Exception $e ) {
4462:             }
4463: 
4464:             try {
4465:                 $this->adapter->exec( "DROP VIEW IF EXISTS `$t`" );
4466:             } catch (\Exception $e ) {
4467:             }
4468:         }
4469:
