6566:      * the adapter, the query writer and the core functionality of RedBeanPHP in
6567:      * OODB.
6568:      *
6569:      * @param OODB              $oodb    Object Database
6570:      * @param DBAdapter $adapter Adapter
6571:      * @param QueryWriter       $writer  Writer
6572:      *
6573:      * @return ToolBox
6574:      */
6575:     public function __construct( OODB $oodb, Adapter $adapter, QueryWriter $writer )
6576:     {
6577:         $this->oodb    = $oodb;
6578:         $this->adapter = $adapter;
6579:         $this->writer  = $writer;
6580: 
6581:         return $this;
6582:     }
6583: 
6584:     /**
6585:      * Returns the query writer in this toolbox.
6586:      * The Query Writer is responsible for building the queries for a
6587:      * specific database and executing them through the adapter.
6588:      *
6589:      * @return QueryWriter
6590:      */
6591:     public function getWriter()
6592:     {
6593:         return $this->writer;
6594:     }
6595: 
6596:     /**
6597:      * Returns the OODB instance in this toolbox.
6598:      * OODB is responsible for creating, storing, retrieving and deleting 
6599:      * single beans. Other components rely
6600:      * on OODB for their basic functionality.
6601:      *
6602:      * @return OODB
6603:      */
6604:     public function getRedBean()
6605:     {
6606:         return $this->oodb;
6607:     }
6608: 
6609:     /**
6610:      * Returns the database adapter in this toolbox.
6611:      * The adapter is responsible for executing the query and binding the values.
6612:      * The adapter also takes care of transaction handling.
6613:      * 
6614:      * @return DBAdapter
6615:      */
6616:     public function getDatabaseAdapter()
6617:     {
6618:         return $this->adapter;
6619:     }
6620: }
6621: }
6622: 
6623: namespace RedBeanPHP {
6624: 
6625: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
6626: use RedBeanPHP\OODB as OODB;
6627: use RedBeanPHP\RedException\Security as Security;
6628: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
6629: 
6630: /**
6631:  * RedBean Finder
6632:  *
6633:  * @file    RedBean/Finder.php
6634:  * @desc    Helper class to harmonize APIs.
6635:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
6636:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
6637:  *
6638:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
6639:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
6640:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
6641:  */
6642: class Finder
6643: {
6644: 
6645:     /**
6646:      * @var ToolBox
6647:      */
6648:     protected $toolbox;
6649: 
6650:     /**
6651:      * @var OODB
6652:      */
6653:     protected $redbean;
6654: 
6655:     /**
6656:      * Constructor.
6657:      * The Finder requires a toolbox.
6658:      *
6659:      * @param ToolBox $toolbox
6660:      */
6661:     public function __construct( ToolBox $toolbox )
6662:     {
6663:         $this->toolbox = $toolbox;
6664:         $this->redbean = $toolbox->getRedBean();
6665:     }
6666: 
6667:     /**
6668:      * Finds a bean using a type and a where clause (SQL).
6669:      * As with most Query tools in RedBean you can provide values to
6670:      * be inserted in the SQL statement by populating the value
6671:      * array parameter; you can either use the question mark notation
6672:      * or the slot-notation (:keyname).
6673:      *
6674:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
6675:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
6676:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
6677:      *
6678:      * @return array
6679:      *
6680:      * @throws Security
6681:      */
6682:     public function find( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
6683:     {
6684:         if ( !is_array( $bindings ) ) {
6685:             throw new RedException(
6686:                 'Expected array, ' . gettype( $bindings ) . ' given.'
6687:             );
6688:         }
6689: 
6690:         return $this->redbean->find( $type, array(), $sql, $bindings );
6691:     }
6692: 
6693:     /**
6694:      * @see Finder::find
6695:      *      The variation also exports the beans (i.e. it returns arrays).
6696:      *
6697:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
6698:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
6699:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
6700:      *
6701:      * @return array
6702:      */
6703:     public function findAndExport( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
6704:     {
6705:         $arr = array();
6706:         foreach ( $this->find( $type, $sql, $bindings ) as $key => $item ) {
6707:             $arr[] = $item->export();
6708:         }
6709: 
6710:         return $arr;
6711:     }
6712: 
6713:     /**
6714:      * @see Finder::find
6715:      *      This variation returns the first bean only.
6716:      *
6717:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
6718:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
6719:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
6720:      *
6721:      * @return OODBBean
6722:      */
6723:     public function findOne( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
6724:     {
6725:         $items = $this->find( $type, $sql, $bindings );
6726: 
6727:         if ( empty($items) ) {
6728:             return NULL;
6729:         }
6730: 
6731:         return reset( $items );
6732:     }
6733: 
6734:     /**
6735:      * @see Finder::find
6736:      *      This variation returns the last bean only.
6737:      *
6738:      * @param string $type     the type of bean you are looking for
6739:      * @param string $sql      SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
6740:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
6741:      *
6742:      * @return OODBBean
6743:      */
6744:     public function findLast( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
6745:     {
6746:         $items = $this->find( $type, $sql, $bindings );
6747: 
6748:         if ( empty($items) ) {
6749:             return NULL;
6750:         }
6751: 
6752:         return end( $items );
6753:     }
6754: 
6755:     /**
6756:      * @see Finder::find
6757:      *      Convience method. Tries to find beans of a certain type,
6758:      *      if no beans are found, it dispenses a bean of that type.
6759:      *
6760:      * @param  string $type     the type of bean you are looking for
6761:      * @param  string $sql      SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
6762:      * @param  array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
6763:      *
6764:      * @return array
6765:      */
6766:     public function findOrDispense( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
6767:     {
6768:         $foundBeans = $this->find( $type, $sql, $bindings );
6769: 
6770:         if ( empty( $foundBeans ) ) {
6771:             return array( $this->redbean->dispense( $type ) );
6772:         } else {
6773:             return $foundBeans;
6774:         }
6775:     }
6776: }
6777: }
6778: 
6779: namespace RedBeanPHP {
6780: 
6781: use RedBeanPHP\Observable as Observable;
6782: use RedBeanPHP\OODB as OODB;
6783: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter\DBAdapter as DBAdapter;
6784: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter as QueryWriter;
6785: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
6786: use RedBeanPHP\RedException as RedException;
6787: use RedBeanPHP\RedException\Security as Security;
6788: use RedBeanPHP\RedException\SQL as SQL;
6789: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
6790: 
6791: /**
6792:  * Association Manager
6793:  *
6794:  * @file    RedBean/AssociationManager.php
6795:  * @desc    Manages simple bean associations.
6796:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
6797:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
6798:  *
6799:  * (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
6800:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
6801:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
6802:  */
6803: class AssociationManager extends Observable
6804: {
6805: 
6806:     /**
6807:      * @var OODB
6808:      */
6809:     protected $oodb;
6810: 
6811:     /**
6812:      * @var DBAdapter
6813:      */
6814:     protected $adapter;
6815: 
6816:     /**
6817:      * @var QueryWriter
6818:      */
6819:     protected $writer;
6820: 
6821:     /**
6822:      * Handles\Exceptions. Suppresses exceptions caused by missing structures.
6823:      *
6824:      * @param\Exception $exception
6825:      *
6826:      * @return void
6827:      *
6828:      * @throws\Exception
6829:      */
6830:     private function handleException(\Exception $exception )
6831:     {
6832:         if ( $this->oodb->isFrozen() || !$this->writer->sqlStateIn( $exception->getSQLState(),
6833:             array(
6834:                 QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_TABLE,
6835:                 QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_COLUMN )
6836:             )
6837:         ) {
6838:             throw $exception;
6839:         }
6840:     }
6841: 
6842:     /**
6843:      * Internal method.
6844:      * Returns the many-to-many related rows of table $type for bean $bean using additional SQL in $sql and
6845:      * $bindings bindings. If $getLinks is TRUE, link rows are returned instead.
6846:      *
6847:      * @param OODBBean $bean     reference bean
6848:      * @param string           $type     target type
6849:      * @param string           $sql      additional SQL snippet
6850:      * @param array            $bindings bindings
6851:      *
6852:      * @return array
6853:      *
6854:      * @throws Security
6855:      * @throws SQL
6856:      */
6857:     private function relatedRows( $bean, $type, $sql = '', $bindings = array() )
6858:     {
6859:         $ids = array( $bean->id );
6860:         $sourceType = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
6861:         try {
6862:             return $this->writer->queryRecordRelated( $sourceType, $type, $ids, $sql, $bindings );
6863:         } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
6864:             $this->handleException( $exception );
6865:             return array();
6866:         }
6867:     }
6868: 
6869:     /**
6870:      * Associates a pair of beans. This method associates two beans, no matter
6871:      * what types. Accepts a base bean that contains data for the linking record.
6872:      * This method is used by associate. This method also accepts a base bean to be used
6873:      * as the template for the link record in the database.
6874:      *
6875:      * @param OODBBean $bean1 first bean
6876:      * @param OODBBean $bean2 second bean
6877:      * @param OODBBean $bean  base bean (association record)
6878:      *
6879:      * @throws\Exception|SQL
6880:      *
6881:      * @return mixed
6882:      */
6883:     protected function associateBeans( OODBBean $bean1, OODBBean $bean2, OODBBean $bean )
6884:     {
6885:         $property1 = $bean1->getMeta( 'type' ) . '_id';
6886:         $property2 = $bean2->getMeta( 'type' ) . '_id';
6887: 
6888:         if ( $property1 == $property2 ) {
6889:             $property2 = $bean2->getMeta( 'type' ) . '2_id';
6890:         }
6891:         
6892:         //Dont mess with other tables, only add the unique constraint if:
6893:         //1. the table exists (otherwise we cant inspect it)
6894:         //2. the table only contains N-M fields: ID, N-ID, M-ID.
6895:         $unique = array( $property1, $property2 );
6896:         $type = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
6897:         $tables = $this->writer->getTables();
6898:         if ( in_array( $type, $tables ) && !$this->oodb->isChilled( $type ) ) {
6899:             $columns = ( $this->writer->getColumns( $type ) );
6900:             if ( count( $columns ) === 3 
6901:                 && isset( $columns[ 'id' ] )
6902:                 && isset( $columns[ $property1 ] ) 
6903:                 && isset( $columns[ $property2 ] ) ) {
6904:                 $bean->setMeta( 'buildcommand.unique', array( $unique ) );
6905:             }
6906:         }
6907: 
6908:         //add a build command for Single Column Index (to improve performance in case unqiue cant be used)
6909:         $indexName1 = 'index_for_' . $bean->getMeta( 'type' ) . '_' . $property1;
6910:         $indexName2 = 'index_for_' . $bean->getMeta( 'type' ) . '_' . $property2;
6911: 
6912:         $bean->setMeta( 'buildcommand.indexes', array( $property1 => $indexName1, $property2 => $indexName2 ) );
6913: 
6914:         $this->oodb->store( $bean1 );
6915:         $this->oodb->store( $bean2 );
6916: 
6917:         $bean->setMeta( "cast.$property1", "id" );
6918:         $bean->setMeta( "cast.$property2", "id" );
6919: 
6920:         $bean->$property1 = $bean1->id;
6921:         $bean->$property2 = $bean2->id;
6922: 
6923:         $results   = array();
6924:         try {
6925:             $id = $this->oodb->store( $bean );
6926: 
6927:             //On creation, add constraints....
6928:             if ( !$this->oodb->isFrozen() &&
6929:                 $bean->getMeta( 'buildreport.flags.created' )
6930:             ) {
6931:                 $bean->setMeta( 'buildreport.flags.created', 0 );
6932:                 if ( !$this->oodb->isFrozen() ) {
6933:                     $this->writer->addConstraintForTypes( $bean1->getMeta( 'type' ), $bean2->getMeta( 'type' ) );
6934:                 }
6935:             }
6936:             $results[] = $id;
6937:         } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
6938:             if ( !$this->writer->sqlStateIn( $exception->getSQLState(),
6939:                 array( QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_INTEGRITY_CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION ) )
6940:             ) {
6941:                 throw $exception;
6942:             }
6943:         }
6944: 
6945:         return $results;
6946:     }
6947: 
6948:     /**
6949:      * Constructor
6950:      *
6951:      * @param ToolBox $tools toolbox
6952:      */
6953:     public function __construct( ToolBox $tools )
6954:     {
6955:         $this->oodb    = $tools->getRedBean();
6956:         $this->adapter = $tools->getDatabaseAdapter();
6957:         $this->writer  = $tools->getWriter();
6958:         $this->toolbox = $tools;
6959:     }
6960: 
6961:     /**
6962:      * Creates a table name based on a types array.
6963:      * Manages the get the correct name for the linking table for the
6964:      * types provided.
6965:      *
6966:      * @todo find a nice way to decouple this class from QueryWriter?
6967:      *
6968:      * @param array $types 2 types as strings
6969:      *
6970:      * @return string
6971:      */
6972:     public function getTable( $types )
6973:     {
6974:         return $this->writer->getAssocTable( $types );
6975:     }
6976: 
6977:     /**
6978:      * Associates two beans in a many-to-many relation.
6979:      * This method will associate two beans and store the connection between the
6980:      * two in a link table. Instead of two single beans this method also accepts
6981:      * two sets of beans. Returns the ID or the IDs of the linking beans.
6982:      * 
6983:      * @param OODBBean|array $beans1 one or more beans to form the association
6984:      * @param OODBBean|array $beans2 one or more beans to form the association
6985:      *
6986:      * @return array
6987:      */
6988:     public function associate( $beans1, $beans2 )
6989:     {
6990:         if ( !is_array( $beans1 ) ) {
6991:             $beans1 = array( $beans1 );
6992:         }
6993: 
6994:         if ( !is_array( $beans2 ) ) {
6995:             $beans2 = array( $beans2 );
6996:         }
6997: 
6998:         $results = array();
6999:         foreach ( $beans1 as $bean1 ) {
7000:             foreach ( $beans2 as $bean2 ) {
7001:                 $table     = $this->getTable( array( $bean1->getMeta( 'type' ), $bean2->getMeta( 'type' ) ) );
7002:                 $bean      = $this->oodb->dispense( $table );
7003:                 $results[] = $this->associateBeans( $bean1, $bean2, $bean );
7004:             }
7005:         }
7006: 
7007:         return ( count( $results ) > 1 ) ? $results : reset( $results );
7008:     }
7009: 
7010:     /**
7011:      * Counts the number of related beans in an N-M relation.
7012:      * This method returns the number of beans of type $type associated
7013:      * with reference bean(s) $bean. The query can be tuned using an
7014:      * SQL snippet for additional filtering.
7015:      *
7016:      * @param OODBBean|array $bean     a bean object or an array of beans
7017:      * @param string                 $type     type of bean you're interested in
7018:      * @param string                 $sql      SQL snippet (optional)
7019:      * @param array                  $bindings bindings for your SQL string
7020:      *
7021:      * @return integer
7022:      *
7023:      * @throws Security
7024:      */
7025:     public function relatedCount( $bean, $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
7026:     {
7027:         if ( !( $bean instanceof OODBBean ) ) {
7028:             throw new RedException(
7029:                 'Expected array or OODBBean but got:' . gettype( $bean )
7030:             );
7031:         }
7032: 
7033:         if ( !$bean->id ) {
7034:             return 0;
7035:         }
7036: 
7037:         $beanType = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
7038: 
7039:         try {
7040:             return $this->writer->queryRecordCountRelated( $beanType, $type, $bean->id, $sql, $bindings );
7041:         } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
7042:             $this->handleException( $exception );
7043: 
7044:             return 0;
7045:         }
7046:     }
7047: 
7048:     /**
7049:      * Breaks the association between two beans. This method unassociates two beans. If the
7050:      * method succeeds the beans will no longer form an association. In the database
7051:      * this means that the association record will be removed. This method uses the
7052:      * OODB trash() method to remove the association links, thus giving FUSE models the
7053:      * opportunity to hook-in additional business logic. If the $fast parameter is
7054:      * set to boolean TRUE this method will remove the beans without their consent,
7055:      * bypassing FUSE. This can be used to improve performance.
7056:      *
7057:      * @param OODBBean $bean1 first bean
7058:      * @param OODBBean $bean2 second bean
7059:      * @param boolean          $fast  If TRUE, removes the entries by query without FUSE
7060:      *
7061:      * @return void
7062:      */
7063:     public function unassociate( $beans1, $beans2, $fast = NULL )
7064:     {
7065:         $beans1 = ( !is_array( $beans1 ) ) ? array( $beans1 ) : $beans1;
7066:         $beans2 = ( !is_array( $beans2 ) ) ? array( $beans2 ) : $beans2;
7067: 
7068:         foreach ( $beans1 as $bean1 ) {
7069:             foreach ( $beans2 as $bean2 ) {
7070:                 try {
7071:                     $this->oodb->store( $bean1 );
7072:                     $this->oodb->store( $bean2 );
7073: 
7074:                     $type1 = $bean1->getMeta( 'type' );
7075:                     $type2 = $bean2->getMeta( 'type' );
7076: 
7077:                     $row      = $this->writer->queryRecordLink( $type1, $type2, $bean1->id, $bean2->id );
7078:                     $linkType = $this->getTable( array( $type1, $type2 ) );
7079: 
7080:                     if ( $fast ) {
7081:                         $this->writer->deleteRecord( $linkType, array( 'id' => $row['id'] ) );
7082: 
7083:                         return;
7084:                     }
7085: 
7086:                     $beans = $this->oodb->convertToBeans( $linkType, array( $row ) );
7087: 
7088:                     if ( count( $beans ) > 0 ) {
7089:                         $bean = reset( $beans );
7090:                         $this->oodb->trash( $bean );
7091:                     }
7092:                 } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
7093:                     $this->handleException( $exception );
7094:                 }
7095:             }
7096:         }
7097:     }
7098: 
7099:     /**
7100:      * Removes all relations for a bean. This method breaks every connection between
7101:      * a certain bean $bean and every other bean of type $type. Warning: this method
7102:      * is really fast because it uses a direct SQL query however it does not inform the
7103:      * models about this. If you want to notify FUSE models about deletion use a foreach-loop
7104:      * with unassociate() instead. (that might be slower though)
7105:      *
7106:      * @param OODBBean $bean reference bean
7107:      * @param string           $type type of beans that need to be unassociated
7108:      *
7109:      * @return void
7110:      */
7111:     public function clearRelations( OODBBean $bean, $type )
7112:     {
7113:         $this->oodb->store( $bean );
7114:         try {
7115:             $this->writer->deleteRelations( $bean->getMeta( 'type' ), $type, $bean->id );
7116:         } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
7117:             $this->handleException( $exception );
7118:         }
7119:     }
7120: 
7121:     /**
7122:      * Returns all the beans associated with $bean.
7123:      * This method will return an array containing all the beans that have
7124:      * been associated once with the associate() function and are still
7125:      * associated with the bean specified. The type parameter indicates the
7126:      * type of beans you are looking for. You can also pass some extra SQL and
7127:      * values for that SQL to filter your results after fetching the
7128:      * related beans.
7129:      *
7130:      * Don't try to make use of subqueries, a subquery using IN() seems to
7131:      * be slower than two queries!
7132:      *
7133:      * Since 3.2, you can now also pass an array of beans instead just one
7134:      * bean as the first parameter.
7135:      *
7136:      * @param OODBBean|array $bean      the bean you have
7137:      * @param string                 $type      the type of beans you want
7138:      * @param string                 $sql       SQL snippet for extra filtering
7139:      * @param array                  $bindings  values to be inserted in SQL slots
7140:      * @param boolean                $glue      whether the SQL should be prefixed with WHERE
7141:      *
7142:      * @return array
7143:      */
7144:     public function related( $bean, $type, $sql = '', $bindings = array() )
7145:     {
7146:         $sql   = $this->writer->glueSQLCondition( $sql );
7147: 
7148:         $rows  = $this->relatedRows( $bean, $type, $sql, $bindings );
7149: 
7150:         $links = array();
7151:         foreach ( $rows as $key => $row ) {
7152:             if ( !isset( $links[$row['id']] ) ) {
7153:                 $links[$row['id']] = array();
7154:             }
7155: 
7156:             $links[$row['id']][] = $row['linked_by'];
7157: 
7158:             unset( $rows[$key]['linked_by'] );
7159:         }
7160: 
7161:         $beans = $this->oodb->convertToBeans( $type, $rows );
7162: 
7163:         foreach ( $beans as $bean ) {
7164:             $bean->setMeta( 'sys.belongs-to', $links[$bean->id] );
7165:         }
7166: 
7167:         return $beans;
7168:     }
7169: }
7170: }
7171: 
7172: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7173: 
7174: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
7175: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7176: 
7177: /**
7178:  * Bean Helper Interface
7179:  *
7180:  * @file    RedBean/IBeanHelper.php
7181:  * @desc    Interface for Bean Helper.
7182:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7183:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
7184:  *
7185:  * Interface for Bean Helper.
7186:  * A little bolt that glues the whole machinery together.
7187:  *
7188:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7189:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7190:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7191:  */
7192: interface BeanHelper
7193: {
7194: 
7195:     /**
7196:      * Returns a toolbox to empower the bean.
7197:      * This allows beans to perform OODB operations by themselves,
7198:      * as such the bean is a proxy for OODB. This allows beans to implement
7199:      * their magic getters and setters and return lists.
7200:      *
7201:      * @return ToolBox $toolbox toolbox
7202:      */
7203:     public function getToolbox();
7204: 
7205:     /**
7206:      * Does approximately the same as getToolbox but also extracts the
7207:      * toolbox for you.
7208:      * This method returns a list with all toolbox items in Toolbox Constructor order:
7209:      * OODB, adapter, writer and finally the toolbox itself!.
7210:      *
7211:      * @return array
7212:      */
7213:     public function getExtractedToolbox();
7214: 
7215:     /**
7216:      * Given a certain bean this method will
7217:      * return the corresponding model.
7218:      *
7219:      * @param OODBBean $bean
7220:      *
7221:      * @return string
7222:      */
7223:     public function getModelForBean( OODBBean $bean );
7224: }
7225: }
7226: 
7227: namespace RedBeanPHP\BeanHelper {
7228: 
7229: use RedBeanPHP\BeanHelper as BeanHelper;
7230: use RedBeanPHP\Facade as Facade;
7231: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7232: use RedBeanPHP\SimpleModelHelper as SimpleModelHelper;
7233: 
7234: /**
7235:  * Bean Helper.
7236:  * The Bean helper helps beans to access access the toolbox and
7237:  * FUSE models. This Bean Helper makes use of the facade to obtain a
7238:  * reference to the toolbox.
7239:  *
7240:  * @file    RedBean/BeanHelperFacade.php
7241:  * @desc    Finds the toolbox for the bean.
7242:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7243:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
7244:  *
7245:  * (c) copyright G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7246:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7247:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7248:  */
7249: class SimpleFacadeBeanHelper implements BeanHelper
7250: {
7251: 
7252:     /**
7253:      * Factory function to create instance of Simple Model, if any.
7254:      *
7255:      * @var closure
7256:      */
7257:     private static $factory = null;
7258: 
7259:     /**
7260:      * @see BeanHelper::getToolbox
7261:      */
7262:     public function getToolbox()
7263:     {
7264:         return Facade::getToolBox();
7265:     }
7266: 
7267:     /**
7268:      * @see BeanHelper::getModelForBean
7269:      */
7270:     public function getModelForBean( OODBBean $bean )
7271:     {
7272:         $model     = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
7273:         $prefix    = defined( 'REDBEAN_MODEL_PREFIX' ) ? REDBEAN_MODEL_PREFIX : '\\Model_';
7274: 
7275:         if ( strpos( $model, '_' ) !== FALSE ) {
7276:             $modelParts = explode( '_', $model );
7277:             $modelName = '';
7278:             foreach( $modelParts as $part ) {
7279:                 $modelName .= ucfirst( $part );
7280:             }
7281:             $modelName = $prefix . $modelName;
7282: 
7283:             if ( !class_exists( $modelName ) ) {
7284:                 //second try
7285:                 $modelName = $prefix . ucfirst( $model );
7286:                 
7287:                 if ( !class_exists( $modelName ) ) {
7288:                     return NULL;
7289:                 }
7290:             }
7291: 
7292:         } else {
7293: 
7294:             $modelName = $prefix . ucfirst( $model );
7295:             if ( !class_exists( $modelName ) ) {
7296:                 return NULL;
7297:             }
7298:         }
7299:         $obj = self::factory( $modelName );
7300:         $obj->loadBean( $bean );
7301: 
7302:         return $obj;
7303:     }
7304: 
7305:     /**
7306:      * @see BeanHelper::getExtractedToolbox
7307:      */
7308:     public function getExtractedToolbox()
7309:     {
7310:         return Facade::getExtractedToolbox();
7311:     }
7312: 
7313:     /**
7314:      * Factory method using a customizable factory function to create
7315:      * the instance of the Simple Model.
7316:      *
7317:      * @param string $modelClassName name of the class
7318:      *
7319:      * @return SimpleModel
7320:      */
7321:     public static function factory( $modelClassName )
7322:     {
7323:         $factory = self::$factory;
7324:         return ( $factory ) ? $factory( $modelClassName ) : new $modelClassName();
7325:     }
7326: 
7327:     /**
7328:      * Sets the factory function to create the model when using FUSE
7329:      * to connect a bean to a model.
7330:      *
7331:      * @param closure $factory
7332:      *
7333:      * @return void
7334:      */
7335:     public static function setFactoryFunction( $factory ) 
7336:     {
7337:         self::$factory = $factory;
7338:     }
7339: 
7340: }
7341: } 
7342: 
7343: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7344: 
7345: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7346: 
7347: /**
7348:  * SimpleModel
7349:  * Base Model For All RedBeanPHP Models using FUSE.
7350:  *
7351:  * @file       RedBean/SimpleModel.php
7352:  * @desc       Part of FUSE
7353:  * @author     Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Team
7354:  * @license    BSD/GPLv2
7355:  *
7356:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7357:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7358:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7359:  */
7360: class SimpleModel
7361: {
7362: 
7363:     /**
7364:      * @var OODBBean
7365:      */
7366:     protected $bean;
7367: 
7368:     /**
7369:      * Used by FUSE: the ModelHelper class to connect a bean to a model.
7370:      * This method loads a bean in the model.
7371:      *
7372:      * @param OODBBean $bean bean
7373:      *
7374:      * @return void
7375:      */
7376:     public function loadBean( OODBBean $bean )
7377:     {
7378:         $this->bean = $bean;
7379:     }
7380: 
7381:     /**
7382:      * Magic Getter to make the bean properties available from
7383:      * the $this-scope.
7384:      *
7385:      * @note this method returns a value, not a reference!
7386:      *       To obtain a reference unbox the bean first!
7387:      *
7388:      * @param string $prop property
7389:      *
7390:      * @return mixed
7391:      */
7392:     public function __get( $prop )
7393:     {
7394:         return $this->bean->$prop;
7395:     }
7396: 
7397:     /**
7398:      * Magic Setter.
7399:      * Sets the value directly as a bean property.
7400:      *
7401:      * @param string $prop  property
7402:      * @param mixed  $value value
7403:      *
7404:      * @return void
7405:      */
7406:     public function __set( $prop, $value )
7407:     {
7408:         $this->bean->$prop = $value;
7409:     }
7410: 
7411:     /**
7412:      * Isset implementation.
7413:      * Implements the isset function for array-like access.
7414:      *
7415:      * @param  string $key key to check
7416:      *
7417:      * @return boolean
7418:      */
7419:     public function __isset( $key )
7420:     {
7421:         return isset( $this->bean->$key );
7422:     }
7423: 
7424:     /**
7425:      * Box the bean using the current model.
7426:      * This method wraps the current bean in this model.
7427:      * This method can be reached using FUSE through a simple
7428:      * OODBBean. The method returns a RedBeanPHP Simple Model.
7429:      * This is useful if you would like to rely on PHP type hinting.
7430:      * You can box your beans before passing them to functions or methods
7431:      * with typed parameters.
7432:      *
7433:      * @return SimpleModel
7434:      */
7435:     public function box()
7436:     {
7437:         return $this;
7438:     }
7439: 
7440:     /**
7441:      * Unbox the bean from the model.
7442:      * This method returns the bean inside the model.
7443:      *
7444:      * @return OODBBean
7445:      */
7446:     public function unbox()
7447:     {
7448:         return $this->bean;
7449:     }
7450: }
7451: } 
7452: 
7453: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7454: 
7455: use RedBeanPHP\Observer as Observer;
7456: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7457: use RedBeanPHP\Observable as Observable;
7458: 
7459: /**
7460:  * RedBean Model Helper
7461:  *
7462:  * @file    RedBean/ModelHelper.php
7463:  * @desc    Connects beans to models, in essence
7464:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7465:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
7466:  *
7467:  * This is the core of so-called FUSE.
7468:  *
7469:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7470:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7471:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7472:  */
7473: class SimpleModelHelper implements Observer
7474: {
7475: 
7476:     /**
7477:      * @see Observer::onEvent
7478:      */
7479:     public function onEvent( $eventName, $bean )
7480:     {
7481:         $bean->$eventName();
7482:     }
7483: 
7484:     /**
7485:      * Attaches the FUSE event listeners. Now the Model Helper will listen for
7486:      * CRUD events. If a CRUD event occurs it will send a signal to the model
7487:      * that belongs to the CRUD bean and this model will take over control from
7488:      * there.
7489:      *
7490:      * @param Observable $observable
7491:      *
7492:      * @return void
7493:      */
7494:     public function attachEventListeners( Observable $observable )
7495:     {
7496:         foreach ( array( 'update', 'open', 'delete', 'after_delete', 'after_update', 'dispense' ) as $e ) {
7497:             $observable->addEventListener( $e, $this );
7498:         }
7499:     }
7500: }
7501: } 
7502: 
7503: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7504: 
7505: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
7506: use RedBeanPHP\AssociationManager as AssociationManager;
7507: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7508: 
7509: /**
7510:  * RedBean Tag Manager.
7511:  * The tag manager offers an easy way to quickly implement basic tagging
7512:  * functionality.
7513:  *
7514:  * @file       RedBean/TagManager.php
7515:  * @desc       RedBean Tag Manager
7516:  * @author     Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP community
7517:  * @license    BSD/GPLv2
7518:  *
7519:  * Provides methods to tag beans and perform tag-based searches in the
7520:  * bean database.
7521:  *
7522:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7523:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7524:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7525:  */
7526: class TagManager
7527: {
7528: 
7529:     /**
7530:      * @var ToolBox
7531:      */
7532:     protected $toolbox;
7533: 
7534:     /**
7535:      * @var AssociationManager
7536:      */
7537:     protected $associationManager;
7538: 
7539:     /**
7540:      * @var OODBBean
7541:      */
7542:     protected $redbean;
7543: 
7544:     /**
7545:      * Checks if the argument is a comma separated string, in this case
7546:      * it will split the string into words and return an array instead.
7547:      * In case of an array the argument will be returned 'as is'.
7548:      *
7549:      * @param array|string $tagList list of tags
7550:      *
7551:      * @return array
7552:      */
7553:     private function extractTagsIfNeeded( $tagList )
7554:     {
7555:         if ( $tagList !== FALSE && !is_array( $tagList ) ) {
7556:             $tags = explode( ',', (string) $tagList );
7557:         } else {
7558:             $tags = $tagList;
7559:         }
7560: 
7561:         return $tags;
7562:     }
7563: 
7564:     /**
7565:      * Constructor.
7566:      * The tag manager offers an easy way to quickly implement basic tagging
7567:      * functionality.
7568:      *
7569:      * @param ToolBox $toolbox
7570:      */
7571:     public function __construct( ToolBox $toolbox )
7572:     {
7573:         $this->toolbox = $toolbox;
7574:         $this->redbean = $toolbox->getRedBean();
7575: 
7576:         $this->associationManager = $this->redbean->getAssociationManager();
7577:     }
7578: 
7579:     /**
7580:      * Finds a tag bean by it's title.
7581:      * Internal method.
7582:      *
7583:      * @param string $title title
7584:      *
7585:      * @return OODBBean
7586:      */
7587:     protected function findTagByTitle( $title )
7588:     {
7589:         $beans = $this->redbean->find( 'tag', array( 'title' => array( $title ) ) );
7590: 
7591:         if ( $beans ) {
7592:             $bean = reset( $beans );
7593: 
7594:             return $bean;
7595:         }
7596: 
7597:         return NULL;
7598:     }
7599: 
7600:     /**
7601:      * Tests whether a bean has been associated with one ore more
7602:      * of the listed tags. If the third parameter is TRUE this method
7603:      * will return TRUE only if all tags that have been specified are indeed
7604:      * associated with the given bean, otherwise FALSE.
7605:      * If the third parameter is FALSE this
7606:      * method will return TRUE if one of the tags matches, FALSE if none
7607:      * match.
7608:      * 
7609:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7610:      * of tag names.
7611:      *
7612:      * @param  OODBBean $bean bean to check for tags
7613:      * @param  array|string     $tags list of tags
7614:      * @param  boolean          $all  whether they must all match or just some
7615:      *
7616:      * @return boolean
7617:      */
7618:     public function hasTag( $bean, $tags, $all = FALSE )
7619:     {
7620:         $foundtags = $this->tag( $bean );
7621: 
7622:         $tags = $this->extractTagsIfNeeded( $tags );
7623:         $same = array_intersect( $tags, $foundtags );
7624: 
7625:         if ( $all ) {
7626:             return ( implode( ',', $same ) === implode( ',', $tags ) );
7627:         }
7628: 
7629:         return (bool) ( count( $same ) > 0 );
7630:     }
7631: 
7632:     /**
7633:      * Removes all sepcified tags from the bean. The tags specified in
7634:      * the second parameter will no longer be associated with the bean.
7635:      * 
7636:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7637:      * of tag names.
7638:      *
7639:      * @param  OODBBean $bean    tagged bean
7640:      * @param  array|string     $tagList list of tags (names)
7641:      *
7642:      * @return void
7643:      */
7644:     public function untag( $bean, $tagList )
7645:     {
7646:         $tags = $this->extractTagsIfNeeded( $tagList );
7647: 
7648:         foreach ( $tags as $tag ) {
7649:             if ( $t = $this->findTagByTitle( $tag ) ) {
7650:                 $this->associationManager->unassociate( $bean, $t );
7651:             }
7652:         }
7653:     }
7654: 
7655:     /**
7656:      * Tags a bean or returns tags associated with a bean.
7657:      * If $tagList is NULL or omitted this method will return a
7658:      * comma separated list of tags associated with the bean provided.
7659:      * If $tagList is a comma separated list (string) of tags all tags will
7660:      * be associated with the bean.
7661:      * You may also pass an array instead of a string.
7662:      * 
7663:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7664:      * of tag names.
7665:      *
7666:      * @param OODBBean $bean    bean to be tagged
7667:      * @param array|string     $tagList a list of tags
7668:      *
7669:      * @return array
7670:      */
7671:     public function tag( OODBBean $bean, $tagList = NULL )
7672:     {
7673:         if ( is_null( $tagList ) ) {
7674:             
7675:             $tags = $bean->sharedTag;
7676:             $foundTags = array();
7677: 
7678:             foreach ( $tags as $tag ) {
7679:                 $foundTags[] = $tag->title;
7680:             }
7681: 
7682:             return $foundTags;
7683:         }
7684: 
7685:         $this->associationManager->clearRelations( $bean, 'tag' );
7686:         $this->addTags( $bean, $tagList );
7687: 
7688:         return $tagList;
7689:     }
7690: 
7691:     /**
7692:      * Adds tags to a bean.
7693:      * If $tagList is a comma separated list of tags all tags will
7694:      * be associated with the bean.
7695:      * You may also pass an array instead of a string.
7696:      * 
7697:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7698:      * of tag names.
7699:      *
7700:      * @param OODBBean $bean    bean to add tags to
7701:      * @param array|string     $tagList list of tags to add to bean
7702:      *
7703:      * @return void
7704:      */
7705:     public function addTags( OODBBean $bean, $tagList )
7706:     {
7707:         $tags = $this->extractTagsIfNeeded( $tagList );
7708: 
7709:         if ( $tagList === FALSE ) {
7710:             return;
7711:         }
7712: 
7713:         foreach ( $tags as $tag ) {
7714:             if ( !$t = $this->findTagByTitle( $tag ) ) {
7715:                 $t        = $this->redbean->dispense( 'tag' );
7716:                 $t->title = $tag;
7717: 
7718:                 $this->redbean->store( $t );
7719:             }
7720: 
7721:             $this->associationManager->associate( $bean, $t );
7722:         }
7723:     }
7724: 
7725:     /**
7726:      * Returns all beans that have been tagged with one or more
7727:      * of the specified tags.
7728:      * 
7729:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7730:      * of tag names.
7731:      *
7732:      * @param string       $beanType type of bean you are looking for
7733:      * @param array|string $tagList  list of tags to match
7734:      *
7735:      * @return array
7736:      */
7737:     public function tagged( $beanType, $tagList )
7738:     {
7739:         $tags       = $this->extractTagsIfNeeded( $tagList );
7740: 
7741:         $collection = array();
7742: 
7743:         $tags       = $this->redbean->find( 'tag', array( 'title' => $tags ) );
7744: 
7745:         $list       = 'shared'.ucfirst( $beanType );
7746:         
7747:         if ( is_array( $tags ) && count( $tags ) > 0 ) {
7748:             foreach($tags as $tag) {
7749:                 $collection += $tag->$list;
7750:             }
7751:         }
7752: 
7753:         return $collection;
7754:     }
7755: 
7756:     /**
7757:      * Returns all beans that have been tagged with ALL of the tags given.
7758:      * 
7759:      * Tag list can be either an array with tag names or a comma separated list
7760:      * of tag names.
7761:      * 
7762:      * @param string        $beanType type of bean you are looking for
7763:      * @param array|string  $tagList  list of tags to match
7764:      *
7765:      * @return array
7766:      */
7767:     public function taggedAll( $beanType, $tagList )
7768:     {
7769:         $tags  = $this->extractTagsIfNeeded( $tagList );
7770: 
7771:         $beans = array();
7772:         foreach ( $tags as $tag ) {
7773:             $beans = $this->tagged( $beanType, $tag );
7774:             
7775:             if ( isset( $oldBeans ) ) {
7776:                 $beans = array_intersect_assoc( $beans, $oldBeans );
7777:             }
7778: 
7779:             $oldBeans = $beans;
7780:         }
7781: 
7782:         return $beans;
7783:     }
7784: }
7785: }
7786: 
7787: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7788: 
7789: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
7790: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7791: 
7792: /**
7793:  * Label Maker
7794:  *
7795:  * @file       RedBean/LabelMaker.php
7796:  * @desc       Makes so-called label beans
7797:  * @author     Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7798:  * @license    BSD/GPLv2
7799:  *
7800:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7801:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7802:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7803:  */
7804: class LabelMaker
7805: {
7806: 
7807:     /**
7808:      * @var ToolBox
7809:      */
7810:     protected $toolbox;
7811: 
7812:     /**
7813:      * Constructor.
7814:      *
7815:      * @param ToolBox $toolbox
7816:      */
7817:     public function __construct( ToolBox $toolbox )
7818:     {
7819:         $this->toolbox = $toolbox;
7820:     }
7821: 
7822:     /**
7823:      * A label is a bean with only an id, type and name property.
7824:      * This function will dispense beans for all entries in the array. The
7825:      * values of the array will be assigned to the name property of each
7826:      * individual bean.
7827:      *
7828:      * @param string $type   type of beans you would like to have
7829:      * @param array  $labels list of labels, names for each bean
7830:      *
7831:      * @return array
7832:      */
7833:     public function dispenseLabels( $type, $labels )
7834:     {
7835:         $labelBeans = array();
7836:         foreach ( $labels as $label ) {
7837:             $labelBean       = $this->toolbox->getRedBean()->dispense( $type );
7838:             $labelBean->name = $label;
7839:             $labelBeans[]    = $labelBean;
7840:         }
7841: 
7842:         return $labelBeans;
7843:     }
7844: 
7845:     /**
7846:      * Gathers labels from beans. This function loops through the beans,
7847:      * collects the values of the name properties of each individual bean
7848:      * and stores the names in a new array. The array then gets sorted using the
7849:      * default sort function of PHP (sort).
7850:      *
7851:      * @param array $beans list of beans to loop
7852:      *
7853:      * @return array
7854:      */
7855:     public function gatherLabels( $beans )
7856:     {
7857:         $labels = array();
7858: 
7859:         foreach ( $beans as $bean ) {
7860:             $labels[] = $bean->name;
7861:         }
7862: 
7863:         sort( $labels );
7864: 
7865:         return $labels;
7866:     }
7867:     
7868:     /**
7869:      * Returns a label or an array of labels for use as ENUMs.
7870:      * 
7871:      * @param string $enum ENUM specification for label
7872:      * 
7873:      * @return array|OODBBean
7874:      */
7875:     public function enum( $enum )
7876:     {
7877:         $oodb = $this->toolbox->getRedBean();
7878:         
7879:         if ( strpos( $enum, ':' ) === FALSE ) {
7880:             $type  = $enum;
7881:             $value = FALSE;
7882:         } else {
7883:             list( $type, $value ) = explode( ':', $enum );
7884:             $value                = preg_replace( '/\W+/', '_', strtoupper( trim( $value ) ) );
7885:         }
7886:         
7887:         $values = $oodb->find( $type );
7888:         
7889:         if ( $value === FALSE ) {
7890:             return $values;
7891:         }
7892:         
7893:         foreach( $values as $enumItem ) {
7894:                 if ( $enumItem->name === $value ) return $enumItem; 
7895:         }
7896:         
7897:         $newEnumItems = $this->dispenseLabels( $type, array( $value ) );
7898:         $newEnumItem  = reset( $newEnumItems );
7899:         
7900:         $oodb->store( $newEnumItem );
7901:         
7902:         return $newEnumItem;
7903:     }
7904: }
7905: }
7906: 
7907: namespace RedBeanPHP {
7908: 
7909: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
7910: use RedBeanPHP\OODB as OODB;
7911: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter as QueryWriter;
7912: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter\DBAdapter as DBAdapter;
7913: use RedBeanPHP\AssociationManager as AssociationManager;
7914: use RedBeanPHP\TagManager as TagManager;
7915: use RedBeanPHP\DuplicationManager as DuplicationManager;
7916: use RedBeanPHP\LabelMaker as LabelMaker;
7917: use RedBeanPHP\Finder as Finder;
7918: use RedBeanPHP\RedException\SQL as SQL;
7919: use RedBeanPHP\RedException\Security as Security;
7920: use RedBeanPHP\Logger as Logger;
7921: use RedBeanPHP\Logger\RDefault as RDefault;
7922: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
7923: use RedBeanPHP\SimpleModel as SimpleModel;
7924: use RedBeanPHP\SimpleModelHelper as SimpleModelHelper;
7925: use RedBeanPHP\Adapter as Adapter;
7926: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter\AQueryWriter as AQueryWriter;
7927: use RedBeanPHP\RedException as RedException;
7928: use RedBeanPHP\BeanHelper\SimpleFacadeBeanHelper as SimpleFacadeBeanHelper;
7929: use RedBeanPHP\Driver\RPDO as RPDO;
7930: 
7931: /**
7932:  * RedBean Facade
7933:  *
7934:  * Version Information
7935:  * RedBean Version @version 4
7936:  *
7937:  * @file    RedBean/Facade.php
7938:  * @desc    Convenience class for RedBeanPHP.
7939:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7940:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
7941:  *
7942:  * This class hides the object landscape of
7943:  * RedBeanPHP behind a single letter class providing
7944:  * almost all functionality with simple static calls.
7945:  *
7946:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
7947:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
7948:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
7949:  */
7950: class Facade
7951: {
7952:     /**
7953:      * RedBeanPHP version constant.
7954:      */
7955:     const C_REDBEANPHP_VERSION = '4.0';
7956:     
7957:     /**
7958:      * @var array
7959:      */
7960:     private static $toolboxes = array();
7961: 
7962:     /**
7963:      * @var ToolBox
7964:      */
7965:     private static $toolbox;
7966: 
7967:     /**
7968:      * @var OODB
7969:      */
7970:     private static $redbean;
7971: 
7972:     /**
7973:      * @var QueryWriter
7974:      */
7975:     private static $writer;
7976: 
7977:     /**
7978:      * @var DBAdapter
7979:      */
7980:     private static $adapter;
7981: 
7982:     /**
7983:      * @var AssociationManager
7984:      */
7985:     private static $associationManager;
7986: 
7987:     /**
7988:      * @var TagManager
7989:      */
7990:     private static $tagManager;
7991: 
7992:     /**
7993:      * @var DuplicationManager
7994:      */
7995:     private static $duplicationManager;
7996: 
7997:     /**
7998:      * @var LabelMaker
7999:      */
8000:     private static $labelMaker;
8001: 
8002:     /**
8003:      * @var Finder
8004:      */
8005:     private static $finder;
8006: 
8007:     /**
8008:      * @var string
8009:      */
8010:     private static $currentDB = '';
8011: 
8012:     /**
8013:      * @var array
8014:      */
8015:     private static $plugins = array();
8016: 
8017:     /**
8018:      * Internal Query function, executes the desired query. Used by
8019:      * all facade query functions. This keeps things DRY.
8020:      *
8021:      * @throws SQL
8022:      *
8023:      * @param string $method   desired query method (i.e. 'cell', 'col', 'exec' etc..)
8024:      * @param string $sql      the sql you want to execute
8025:      * @param array  $bindings array of values to be bound to query statement
8026:      *
8027:      * @return array
8028:      */
8029:     private static function query( $method, $sql, $bindings )
8030:     {
8031:         if ( !self::$redbean->isFrozen() ) {
8032:             try {
8033:                 $rs = Facade::$adapter->$method( $sql, $bindings );
8034:             } catch ( SQL $exception ) {
8035:                 if ( self::$writer->sqlStateIn( $exception->getSQLState(),
8036:                     array(
8037:                         QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_COLUMN,
8038:                         QueryWriter::C_SQLSTATE_NO_SUCH_TABLE )
8039:                     )
8040:                 ) {
8041:                     return ( $method === 'getCell' ) ? NULL : array();
8042:                 } else {
8043:                     throw $exception;
8044:                 }
8045:             }
8046: 
8047:             return $rs;
8048:         } else {
8049:             return Facade::$adapter->$method( $sql, $bindings );
8050:         }
8051:     }
8052: 
8053:     /**
8054:      * Returns the RedBeanPHP version string.
8055:      * The RedBeanPHP version string always has the same format "X.Y"
8056:      * where X is the major version number and Y is the minor version number.
8057:      * Point releases are not mentioned in the version string.
8058:      * 
8059:      * @return string
8060:      */
8061:     public static function getVersion()
8062:     {
8063:         return self::C_REDBEANPHP_VERSION;
8064:     }
8065:     
8066:     /**
8067:      * Kickstarts redbean for you. This method should be called before you start using
8068:      * RedBean. The Setup() method can be called without any arguments, in this case it will
8069:      * try to create a SQLite database in /tmp called red.db (this only works on UNIX-like systems).
8070:      *
8071:      * @param string  $dsn      Database connection string
8072:      * @param string  $username Username for database
8073:      * @param string  $password Password for database
8074:      * @param boolean $frozen   TRUE if you want to setup in frozen mode
8075:      *
8076:      * @return ToolBox
8077:      */
8078:     public static function setup( $dsn = NULL, $username = NULL, $password = NULL, $frozen = FALSE )
8079:     {
8080:         if ( is_null( $dsn ) ) {
8081:             $dsn = 'sqlite:/' . sys_get_temp_dir() . '/red.db';
8082:         }
8083: 
8084:         self::addDatabase( 'default', $dsn, $username, $password, $frozen );
8085:         self::selectDatabase( 'default' );
8086: 
8087:         return self::$toolbox;
8088:     }
8089: 
8090:     /**
8091:      * Starts a transaction within a closure (or other valid callback).
8092:      * If an\Exception is thrown inside, the operation is automatically rolled back.
8093:      * If no\Exception happens, it commits automatically.
8094:      * It also supports (simulated) nested transactions (that is useful when
8095:      * you have many methods that needs transactions but are unaware of
8096:      * each other).
8097:      * ex:
8098:      *        $from = 1;
8099:      *        $to = 2;
8100:      *        $amount = 300;
8101:      *
8102:      *        R::transaction(function() use($from, $to, $amount)
8103:      *        {
8104:      *            $accountFrom = R::load('account', $from);
8105:      *            $accountTo = R::load('account', $to);
8106:      *
8107:      *            $accountFrom->money -= $amount;
8108:      *            $accountTo->money += $amount;
8109:      *
8110:      *            R::store($accountFrom);
8111:      *            R::store($accountTo);
8112:      *      });
8113:      *
8114:      * @param callable $callback Closure (or other callable) with the transaction logic
8115:      *
8116:      * @throws Security
8117:      *
8118:      * @return mixed
8119:      *
8120:      */
8121:     public static function transaction( $callback )
8122:     {
8123:         if ( !is_callable( $callback ) ) {
8124:             throw new RedException( 'R::transaction needs a valid callback.' );
8125:         }
8126: 
8127:         static $depth = 0;
8128:         $result = null;
8129:         try {
8130:             if ( $depth == 0 ) {
8131:                 self::begin();
8132:             }
8133:             $depth++;
8134:             $result = call_user_func( $callback ); //maintain 5.2 compatibility
8135:             $depth--;
8136:             if ( $depth == 0 ) {
8137:                 self::commit();
8138:             }
8139:         } catch (\Exception $exception ) {
8140:             $depth--;
8141:             if ( $depth == 0 ) {
8142:                 self::rollback();
8143:             }
8144:             throw $exception;
8145:         }
8146:         return $result;
8147:     }
8148: 
8149:     /**
8150:      * Adds a database to the facade, afterwards you can select the database using
8151:      * selectDatabase($key), where $key is the name you assigned to this database.
8152:      * 
8153:      * Usage:
8154:      * 
8155:      * R::addDatabase( 'database-1', 'sqlite:/tmp/db1.txt' );
8156:      * R::selectDatabase( 'database-1' ); //to select database again
8157:      * 
8158:      * This method allows you to dynamically add (and select) new databases
8159:      * to the facade. Adding a database with the same key will cause an exception.
8160:      *
8161:      * @param string      $key    ID for the database
8162:      * @param string      $dsn    DSN for the database
8163:      * @param string      $user   User for connection
8164:      * @param NULL|string $pass   Password for connection
8165:      * @param bool        $frozen Whether this database is frozen or not
8166:      *
8167:      * @return void
8168:      */
8169:     public static function addDatabase( $key, $dsn, $user = NULL, $pass = NULL, $frozen = FALSE )
8170:     {
8171:         if ( isset( self::$toolboxes[$key] ) ) {
8172:             throw new RedException( 'A database has already be specified for this key.' );
8173:         }
8174: 
8175:         if ( is_object($dsn) ) {
8176:             $db  = new RPDO( $dsn );
8177:             $dbType = $db->getDatabaseType();
8178:         } else {
8179:             $db = new RPDO( $dsn, $user, $pass, TRUE );
8180:             $dbType = substr( $dsn, 0, strpos( $dsn, ':' ) );
8181:         }
8182: 
8183:         $adapter = new DBAdapter( $db );
8184: 
8185:         $writers     = array('pgsql'  => 'PostgreSQL', 
8186:                                     'sqlite' => 'SQLiteT', 
8187:                                     'cubrid' => 'CUBRID', 
8188:                                     'mysql'  => 'MySQL');
8189:         
8190:         $wkey = trim( strtolower( $dbType ) );
8191:         if ( !isset( $writers[$wkey] ) ) trigger_error( 'Unsupported DSN: '.$wkey );
8192:         $writerClass = '\\RedBeanPHP\\QueryWriter\\'.$writers[$wkey];
8193:         $writer      = new $writerClass( $adapter ); 
8194:         $redbean     = new OODB( $writer );
8195: 
8196:         $redbean->freeze( ( $frozen === TRUE ) );
8197:         self::$toolboxes[$key] = new ToolBox( $redbean, $adapter, $writer );
8198:     }
8199: 
8200:     /**
8201:      * Selects a different database for the Facade to work with.
8202:      * If you use the R::setup() you don't need this method. This method is meant
8203:      * for multiple database setups. This method selects the database identified by the
8204:      * database ID ($key). Use addDatabase() to add a new database, which in turn
8205:      * can be selected using selectDatabase(). If you use R::setup(), the resulting
8206:      * database will be stored under key 'default', to switch (back) to this database
8207:      * use R::selectDatabase( 'default' ). This method returns TRUE if the database has been
8208:      * switched and FALSE otherwise (for instance if you already using the specified database).
8209:      *
8210:      * @param  string $key Key of the database to select
8211:      *
8212:      * @return boolean
8213:      */
8214:     public static function selectDatabase( $key )
8215:     {
8216:         if ( self::$currentDB === $key ) {
8217:             return FALSE;
8218:         }
8219: 
8220:         self::configureFacadeWithToolbox( self::$toolboxes[$key] );
8221:         self::$currentDB = $key;
8222: 
8223:         return TRUE;
8224:     }
8225: 
8226:     /**
8227:      * Toggles DEBUG mode.
8228:      * In Debug mode all SQL that happens under the hood will
8229:      * be printed to the screen or logged by provided logger.
8230:      * If no database connection has been configured using R::setup() or
8231:      * R::selectDatabase() this method will throw an exception.
8232:      * Returns the attached logger instance.
8233:      *
8234:      * @param boolean $tf
8235:      * @param integer $mode (0 = to STDOUT, 1 = to ARRAY)   
8236:      *
8237:      * @throws Security
8238:      * 
8239:      * @return Logger\RDefault
8240:      */
8241:     public static function debug( $tf = TRUE, $mode = 0 )
8242:     {
8243:         $logger = new RDefault;
8244:         
8245:         if ( !isset( self::$adapter ) ) {
8246:             throw new RedException( 'Use R::setup() first.' );
8247:         }
8248:         $logger->setMode($mode);
8249:         self::$adapter->getDatabase()->setDebugMode( $tf, $logger );
8250:         
8251:         return $logger;
8252:     }
8253: 
8254:     /**
8255:     * Inspects the database schema. If you pass the type of a bean this
8256:     * method will return the fields of its table in the database.
8257:     * The keys of this array will be the field names and the values will be
8258:     * the column types used to store their values.
8259:     * If no type is passed, this method returns a list of all tables in the database.
8260:     *
8261:     * @param string $type Type of bean (i.e. table) you want to inspect
8262:     *
8263:     * @return array
8264:     */
8265:     public static function inspect( $type = NULL )
8266:     {
8267:         return ($type === NULL) ? self::$writer->getTables() : self::$writer->getColumns( $type );
8268:     }
8269: 
8270:     /**
8271:      * Stores a bean in the database. This method takes a
8272:      * OODBBean Bean Object $bean and stores it
8273:      * in the database. If the database schema is not compatible
8274:      * with this bean and RedBean runs in fluid mode the schema
8275:      * will be altered to store the bean correctly.
8276:      * If the database schema is not compatible with this bean and
8277:      * RedBean runs in frozen mode it will throw an exception.
8278:      * This function returns the primary key ID of the inserted
8279:      * bean.
8280:      * 
8281:      * The return value is an integer if possible. If it is not possible to
8282:      * represent the value as an integer a string will be returned.
8283:      *
8284:      * @param OODBBean|SimpleModel $bean bean to store
8285:      *
8286:      * @return integer|string
8287:      *
8288:      * @throws Security
8289:      */
8290:     public static function store( $bean )
8291:     {
8292:         return self::$redbean->store( $bean );
8293:     }
8294: 
8295:     /**
8296:      * Toggles fluid or frozen mode. In fluid mode the database
8297:      * structure is adjusted to accomodate your objects. In frozen mode
8298:      * this is not the case.
8299:      *
8300:      * You can also pass an array containing a selection of frozen types.
8301:      * Let's call this chilly mode, it's just like fluid mode except that
8302:      * certain types (i.e. tables) aren't touched.
8303:      *
8304:      * @param boolean|array $trueFalse
8305:      */
8306:     public static function freeze( $tf = TRUE )
8307:     {
8308:         self::$redbean->freeze( $tf );
8309:     }
8310: 
8311:     /**
8312:      * Loads multiple types of beans with the same ID.
8313:      * This might look like a strange method, however it can be useful
8314:      * for loading a one-to-one relation.
8315:      *
8316:      * Usage:
8317:      * list($author, $bio) = R::load('author, bio', $id);
8318:      *
8319:      * @param string|array $types
8320:      * @param mixed        $id
8321:      *
8322:      * @return OODBBean
8323:      */
8324:     public static function loadMulti( $types, $id )
8325:     {
8326:         if ( is_string( $types ) ) {
8327:             $types = explode( ',', $types );
8328:         }
8329: 
8330:         if ( !is_array( $types ) ) {
8331:             return array();
8332:         }
8333: 
8334:         foreach ( $types as $k => $typeItem ) {
8335:             $types[$k] = self::$redbean->load( $typeItem, $id );
8336:         }
8337: 
8338:         return $types;
8339:     }
8340: 
8341:     /**
8342:      * Loads a bean from the object database.
8343:      * It searches for a OODBBean Bean Object in the
8344:      * database. It does not matter how this bean has been stored.
8345:      * RedBean uses the primary key ID $id and the string $type
8346:      * to find the bean. The $type specifies what kind of bean you
8347:      * are looking for; this is the same type as used with the
8348:      * dispense() function. If RedBean finds the bean it will return
8349:      * the OODB Bean object; if it cannot find the bean
8350:      * RedBean will return a new bean of type $type and with
8351:      * primary key ID 0. In the latter case it acts basically the
8352:      * same as dispense().
8353:      *
8354:      * Important note:
8355:      * If the bean cannot be found in the database a new bean of
8356:      * the specified type will be generated and returned.
8357:      *
8358:      * @param string  $type type of bean you want to load
8359:      * @param integer $id   ID of the bean you want to load
8360:      *
8361:      * @throws SQL
8362:      *
8363:      * @return OODBBean
8364:      */
8365:     public static function load( $type, $id )
8366:     {
8367:         return self::$redbean->load( $type, $id );
8368:     }
8369: 
8370:     /**
8371:      * Removes a bean from the database.
8372:      * This function will remove the specified OODBBean
8373:      * Bean Object from the database.
8374:      *
8375:      * @param OODBBean|SimpleModel $bean bean you want to remove from database
8376:      *
8377:      * @return void
8378:      *
8379:      * @throws Security
8380:      */
8381:     public static function trash( $bean )
8382:     {
8383:         self::$redbean->trash( $bean );
8384:     }
8385: 
8386:     /**
8387:      * Dispenses a new RedBean OODB Bean for use with
8388:      * the rest of the methods.
8389:      *
8390:      * @param string|array $typeOrBeanArray   type or bean array to import
8391:      * @param integer      $number            number of beans to dispense
8392:      * @param boolean        $alwaysReturnArray if TRUE always returns the result as an array
8393:      *
8394:      * @return array|OODBBean
8395:      *
8396:      * @throws Security
8397:      */
8398:     public static function dispense( $typeOrBeanArray, $num = 1, $alwaysReturnArray = FALSE )
8399:     {
8400:         if ( is_array($typeOrBeanArray) ) {
8401:             if ( !isset( $typeOrBeanArray['_type'] ) ) throw new RedException('Missing _type field.');
8402:             $import = $typeOrBeanArray;
8403:             $type = $import['_type'];
8404:             unset( $import['_type'] );
8405:         } else {
8406:             $type = $typeOrBeanArray;
8407:         }
8408:         
8409:         if ( !preg_match( '/^[a-z0-9]+$/', $type ) ) {
8410:             throw new RedException( 'Invalid type: ' . $type );
8411:         }
8412: 
8413:         $beanOrBeans = self::$redbean->dispense( $type, $num, $alwaysReturnArray );
8414:         
8415:         if ( isset( $import ) ) {
8416:             $beanOrBeans->import( $import );
8417:         }
8418:         
8419:         return $beanOrBeans;
8420:     }
8421:     
8422:     /**
8423:      * Takes a comma separated list of bean types
8424:      * and dispenses these beans. For each type in the list
8425:      * you can specify the number of beans to be dispensed.
8426:      * 
8427:      * Usage:
8428:      * 
8429:      * list($book, $page, $text) = R::dispenseAll('book,page,text');
8430:      * 
8431:      * This will dispense a book, a page and a text. This way you can
8432:      * quickly dispense beans of various types in just one line of code.
8433:      * 
8434:      * Usage:
8435:      * 
8436:      * list($book, $pages) = R::dispenseAll('book,page*100');
8437:      * 
8438:      * This returns an array with a book bean and then another array
8439:      * containing 100 page beans.
8440:      * 
8441:      * @param string  $order      a description of the desired dispense order using the syntax above
8442:      * @param boolean $onlyArrays return only arrays even if amount < 2
8443:      * 
8444:      * @return array
8445:      */
8446:     public static function dispenseAll( $order, $onlyArrays = FALSE )
8447:     {
8448: 
8449:         $list = array();
8450: 
8451:         foreach( explode( ',', $order ) as $order ) {
8452:             if ( strpos( $order, '*' ) !== false ) {
8453:                 list( $type, $amount ) = explode( '*', $order );
8454:             } else {
8455:                 $type   = $order;
8456:                 $amount = 1;
8457:             }
8458: 
8459:             $list[] = self::dispense( $type, $amount, $onlyArrays );
8460:         }
8461: 
8462:         return $list;
8463:     }
8464: 
8465:     /**
8466:      * Convience method. Tries to find beans of a certain type,
8467:      * if no beans are found, it dispenses a bean of that type.
8468:      *
8469:      * @param  string $type     type of bean you are looking for
8470:      * @param  string $sql      SQL code for finding the bean
8471:      * @param  array  $bindings parameters to bind to SQL
8472:      *
8473:      * @return array
8474:      */
8475:     public static function findOrDispense( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8476:     {
8477:         return self::$finder->findOrDispense( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8478:     }
8479: 
8480:     /**
8481:      * Finds a bean using a type and a where clause (SQL).
8482:      * As with most Query tools in RedBean you can provide values to
8483:      * be inserted in the SQL statement by populating the value
8484:      * array parameter; you can either use the question mark notation
8485:      * or the slot-notation (:keyname).
8486:      *
8487:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
8488:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
8489:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
8490:      *
8491:      * @return array
8492:      */
8493:     public static function find( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8494:     {
8495:         return self::$finder->find( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8496:     }
8497: 
8498:     /**
8499:      * @see Facade::find
8500:      *      The findAll() method differs from the find() method in that it does
8501:      *      not assume a WHERE-clause, so this is valid:
8502:      *
8503:      * R::findAll('person',' ORDER BY name DESC ');
8504:      *
8505:      * Your SQL does not have to start with a valid WHERE-clause condition.
8506:      *
8507:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
8508:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
8509:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
8510:      *
8511:      * @return array
8512:      */
8513:     public static function findAll( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8514:     {
8515:         return self::$finder->find( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8516:     }
8517: 
8518:     /**
8519:      * @see Facade::find
8520:      * The variation also exports the beans (i.e. it returns arrays).
8521:      *
8522:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
8523:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
8524:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
8525:      *
8526:      * @return array
8527:      */
8528:     public static function findAndExport( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8529:     {
8530:         return self::$finder->findAndExport( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8531:     }
8532: 
8533:     /**
8534:      * @see Facade::find
8535:      * This variation returns the first bean only.
8536:      *
8537:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
8538:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
8539:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
8540:      *
8541:      * @return OODBBean
8542:      */
8543:     public static function findOne( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8544:     {
8545:         return self::$finder->findOne( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8546:     }
8547: 
8548:     /**
8549:      * @see Facade::find
8550:      * This variation returns the last bean only.
8551:      *
8552:      * @param string $type     type   the type of bean you are looking for
8553:      * @param string $sql      sql    SQL query to find the desired bean, starting right after WHERE clause
8554:      * @param array  $bindings values array of values to be bound to parameters in query
8555:      *
8556:      * @return OODBBean
8557:      */
8558:     public static function findLast( $type, $sql = NULL, $bindings = array() )
8559:     {
8560:         return self::$finder->findLast( $type, $sql, $bindings );
8561:     }
8562: 
8563:     /**
8564:      * Returns an array of beans. Pass a type and a series of ids and
8565:      * this method will bring you the corresponding beans.
8566:      *
8567:      * important note: Because this method loads beans using the load()
8568:      * function (but faster) it will return empty beans with ID 0 for
8569:      * every bean that could not be located. The resulting beans will have the
8570:      * passed IDs as their keys.
8571:      *
8572:      * @param string $type type of beans
8573:      * @param array  $ids  ids to load
8574:      *
8575:      * @return array
8576:      */
8577:     public static function batch( $type, $ids )
8578:     {
8579:         return self::$redbean->batch( $type, $ids );
8580:     }
8581:     
8582:     /**
8583:      * @see Facade::batch
8584:      * 
8585:      * Alias for batch(). Batch method is older but since we added so-called *All
8586:      * methods like storeAll, trashAll, dispenseAll and findAll it seemed logical to
8587:      * improve the consistency of the Facade API and also add an alias for batch() called
8588:      * loadAll.
8589:      * 
8590:      * @param string $type type of beans
8591:      * @param array  $ids  ids to load
8592:      *
8593:      * @return array
8594:      */
8595:     public static function loadAll( $type, $ids ) 
8596:     {
8597:         return self::$redbean->batch( $type, $ids );
8598:     }
8599: 
8600:     /**
8601:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8602:      * Executes SQL.
8603:      *
8604:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8605:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8606:      *
8607:      * @return integer
8608:      */
8609:     public static function exec( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8610:     {
8611:         return self::query( 'exec', $sql, $bindings );
8612:     }
8613: 
8614:     /**
8615:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8616:      * Executes SQL.
8617:      *
8618:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8619:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8620:      *
8621:      * @return array
8622:      */
8623:     public static function getAll( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8624:     {
8625:         return self::query( 'get', $sql, $bindings );
8626:     }
8627: 
8628:     /**
8629:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8630:      * Executes SQL.
8631:      *
8632:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8633:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8634:      *
8635:      * @return string
8636:      */
8637:     public static function getCell( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8638:     {
8639:         return self::query( 'getCell', $sql, $bindings );
8640:     }
8641: 
8642:     /**
8643:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8644:      * Executes SQL.
8645:      *
8646:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8647:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8648:      *
8649:      * @return array
8650:      */
8651:     public static function getRow( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8652:     {
8653:         return self::query( 'getRow', $sql, $bindings );
8654:     }
8655: 
8656:     /**
8657:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8658:      * Executes SQL.
8659:      *
8660:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8661:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8662:      *
8663:      * @return array
8664:      */
8665:     public static function getCol( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8666:     {
8667:         return self::query( 'getCol', $sql, $bindings );
8668:     }
8669: 
8670:     /**
8671:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8672:      * Executes SQL.
8673:      * Results will be returned as an associative array. The first
8674:      * column in the select clause will be used for the keys in this array and
8675:      * the second column will be used for the values. If only one column is
8676:      * selected in the query, both key and value of the array will have the
8677:      * value of this field for each row.
8678:      *
8679:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8680:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8681:      *
8682:      * @return array
8683:      */
8684:     public static function getAssoc( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8685:     {
8686:         return self::query( 'getAssoc', $sql, $bindings );
8687:     }
8688:     
8689:     /**
8690:      * Convenience function to execute Queries directly.
8691:      * Executes SQL.
8692:      * Results will be returned as an associative array indexed by the first
8693:      * column in the select.
8694:      * 
8695:      * @param string $sql       sql    SQL query to execute
8696:      * @param array  $bindings  values a list of values to be bound to query parameters
8697:      *
8698:      * @return array
8699:      */
8700:     public static function getAssocRow( $sql, $bindings = array() )
8701:     {
8702:         return self::query( 'getAssocRow', $sql, $bindings );
8703:     }
8704: 
8705:     /**
8706:      * Makes a copy of a bean. This method makes a deep copy
8707:      * of the bean.The copy will have the following features.
8708:      * - All beans in own-lists will be duplicated as well
8709:      * - All references to shared beans will be copied but not the shared beans themselves
8710:      * - All references to parent objects (_id fields) will be copied but not the parents themselves
8711:      * In most cases this is the desired scenario for copying beans.
8712:      * This function uses a trail-array to prevent infinite recursion, if a recursive bean is found
8713:      * (i.e. one that already has been processed) the ID of the bean will be returned.
8714:      * This should not happen though.
8715:      *
8716:      * Note:
8717:      * This function does a reflectional database query so it may be slow.
8718:      *
8719:      * @param OODBBean $bean  bean to be copied
8720:      * @param array            $trail for internal usage, pass array()
8721:      * @param boolean          $pid   for internal usage
8722:      *
8723:      * @return array
8724:      */
8725:     public static function dup( $bean, $trail = array(), $pid = FALSE, $filters = array() )
8726:     {
8727:         self::$duplicationManager->setFilters( $filters );
8728: 
8729:         return self::$duplicationManager->dup( $bean, $trail, $pid );
8730:     }
8731: 
8732:     /**
8733:      * Exports a collection of beans. Handy for XML/JSON exports with a
8734:      * Javascript framework like Dojo or ExtJS.
8735:      * What will be exported:
8736:      * - contents of the bean
8737:      * - all own bean lists (recursively)
