8738:      * - all shared beans (not THEIR own lists)
8739:      *
8740:      * @param    array|OODBBean $beans   beans to be exported
8741:      * @param    boolean                $parents whether you want parent beans to be exported
8742:      * @param   array                   $filters whitelist of types
8743:      *
8744:      * @return    array
8745:      */
8746:     public static function exportAll( $beans, $parents = FALSE, $filters = array() )
8747:     {
8748:         return self::$duplicationManager->exportAll( $beans, $parents, $filters );
8749:     }
8750: 
8751:     /**
8752:      * Converts a series of rows to beans.
8753:      * This method converts a series of rows to beans.
8754:      * The type of the desired output beans can be specified in the
8755:      * first parameter. The second parameter is meant for the database
8756:      * result rows.
8757:      *
8758:      * @param string $type type of beans to produce
8759:      * @param array  $rows must contain an array of array
8760:      *
8761:      * @return array
8762:      */
8763:     public static function convertToBeans( $type, $rows )
8764:     {
8765:         return self::$redbean->convertToBeans( $type, $rows );
8766:     }
8767: 
8768:     /**
8769:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8770:      * Tests whether a bean has been associated with one ore more
8771:      * of the listed tags. If the third parameter is TRUE this method
8772:      * will return TRUE only if all tags that have been specified are indeed
8773:      * associated with the given bean, otherwise FALSE.
8774:      * If the third parameter is FALSE this
8775:      * method will return TRUE if one of the tags matches, FALSE if none
8776:      * match.
8777:      *
8778:      * @param  OODBBean $bean bean to check for tags
8779:      * @param  array            $tags list of tags
8780:      * @param  boolean          $all  whether they must all match or just some
8781:      *
8782:      * @return boolean
8783:      */
8784:     public static function hasTag( $bean, $tags, $all = FALSE )
8785:     {
8786:         return self::$tagManager->hasTag( $bean, $tags, $all );
8787:     }
8788: 
8789:     /**
8790:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8791:      * Removes all specified tags from the bean. The tags specified in
8792:      * the second parameter will no longer be associated with the bean.
8793:      *
8794:      * @param  OODBBean $bean    tagged bean
8795:      * @param  array            $tagList list of tags (names)
8796:      *
8797:      * @return void
8798:      */
8799:     public static function untag( $bean, $tagList )
8800:     {
8801:         self::$tagManager->untag( $bean, $tagList );
8802:     }
8803: 
8804:     /**
8805:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8806:      * Tags a bean or returns tags associated with a bean.
8807:      * If $tagList is NULL or omitted this method will return a
8808:      * comma separated list of tags associated with the bean provided.
8809:      * If $tagList is a comma separated list (string) of tags all tags will
8810:      * be associated with the bean.
8811:      * You may also pass an array instead of a string.
8812:      *
8813:      * @param OODBBean $bean    bean
8814:      * @param mixed            $tagList tags
8815:      *
8816:      * @return string
8817:      */
8818:     public static function tag( OODBBean $bean, $tagList = NULL )
8819:     {
8820:         return self::$tagManager->tag( $bean, $tagList );
8821:     }
8822: 
8823:     /**
8824:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8825:      * Adds tags to a bean.
8826:      * If $tagList is a comma separated list of tags all tags will
8827:      * be associated with the bean.
8828:      * You may also pass an array instead of a string.
8829:      *
8830:      * @param OODBBean $bean    bean
8831:      * @param array            $tagList list of tags to add to bean
8832:      *
8833:      * @return void
8834:      */
8835:     public static function addTags( OODBBean $bean, $tagList )
8836:     {
8837:         self::$tagManager->addTags( $bean, $tagList );
8838:     }
8839: 
8840:     /**
8841:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8842:      * Returns all beans that have been tagged with one of the tags given.
8843:      *
8844:      * @param string $beanType type of bean you are looking for
8845:      * @param array  $tagList  list of tags to match
8846:      *
8847:      * @return array
8848:      */
8849:     public static function tagged( $beanType, $tagList )
8850:     {
8851:         return self::$tagManager->tagged( $beanType, $tagList );
8852:     }
8853: 
8854:     /**
8855:      * Part of RedBeanPHP Tagging API.
8856:      * Returns all beans that have been tagged with ALL of the tags given.
8857:      *
8858:      * @param string $beanType type of bean you are looking for
8859:      * @param array  $tagList  list of tags to match
8860:      *
8861:      * @return array
8862:      */
8863:     public static function taggedAll( $beanType, $tagList )
8864:     {
8865:         return self::$tagManager->taggedAll( $beanType, $tagList );
8866:     }
8867: 
8868:     /**
8869:      * Wipes all beans of type $beanType.
8870:      *
8871:      * @param string $beanType type of bean you want to destroy entirely
8872:      *
8873:      * @return boolean
8874:      */
8875:     public static function wipe( $beanType )
8876:     {
8877:         return Facade::$redbean->wipe( $beanType );
8878:     }
8879: 
8880:     /**
8881:      * Counts the number of beans of type $type.
8882:      * This method accepts a second argument to modify the count-query.
8883:      * A third argument can be used to provide bindings for the SQL snippet.
8884:      *
8885:      * @param string $type     type of bean we are looking for
8886:      * @param string $addSQL   additional SQL snippet
8887:      * @param array  $bindings parameters to bind to SQL
8888:      *
8889:      * @return integer
8890:      *
8891:      * @throws SQL
8892:      */
8893:     public static function count( $type, $addSQL = '', $bindings = array() )
8894:     {
8895:         return Facade::$redbean->count( $type, $addSQL, $bindings );
8896:     }
8897: 
8898:     /**
8899:      * Configures the facade, want to have a new Writer? A new Object Database or a new
8900:      * Adapter and you want it on-the-fly? Use this method to hot-swap your facade with a new
8901:      * toolbox.
8902:      *
8903:      * @param ToolBox $tb toolbox
8904:      *
8905:      * @return ToolBox
8906:      */
8907:     public static function configureFacadeWithToolbox( ToolBox $tb )
8908:     {
8909:         $oldTools                 = self::$toolbox;
8910: 
8911:         self::$toolbox            = $tb;
8912: 
8913:         self::$writer             = self::$toolbox->getWriter();
8914:         self::$adapter            = self::$toolbox->getDatabaseAdapter();
8915:         self::$redbean            = self::$toolbox->getRedBean();
8916:         self::$finder             = new Finder( self::$toolbox );
8917: 
8918:         self::$associationManager = new AssociationManager( self::$toolbox );
8919: 
8920:         self::$redbean->setAssociationManager( self::$associationManager );
8921: 
8922:         self::$labelMaker         = new LabelMaker( self::$toolbox );
8923:         
8924:         $helper                   = new SimpleModelHelper();
8925: 
8926:         $helper->attachEventListeners( self::$redbean );
8927:         
8928:         self::$redbean->setBeanHelper( new SimpleFacadeBeanHelper );
8929: 
8930:         self::$associationManager->addEventListener( 'delete', $helper );
8931: 
8932:         self::$duplicationManager = new DuplicationManager( self::$toolbox );
8933:         self::$tagManager         = new TagManager( self::$toolbox );
8934:         
8935:         return $oldTools;
8936:     }
8937: 
8938:     /**
8939:      * Facade Convience method for adapter transaction system.
8940:      * Begins a transaction.
8941:      *
8942:      * @return bool
8943:      */
8944:     public static function begin()
8945:     {
8946:         if ( !self::$redbean->isFrozen() ) return FALSE;
8947: 
8948:         self::$adapter->startTransaction();
8949: 
8950:         return TRUE;
8951:     }
8952: 
8953:     /**
8954:      * Facade Convience method for adapter transaction system.
8955:      * Commits a transaction.
8956:      *
8957:      * @return bool
8958:      */
8959:     public static function commit()
8960:     {
8961:         if ( !self::$redbean->isFrozen() ) return FALSE;
8962: 
8963:         self::$adapter->commit();
8964: 
8965:         return TRUE;
8966:     }
8967: 
8968:     /**
8969:      * Facade Convience method for adapter transaction system.
8970:      * Rolls back a transaction.
8971:      *
8972:      * @return bool
8973:      */
8974:     public static function rollback()
8975:     {
8976:         if ( !self::$redbean->isFrozen() ) return FALSE;
8977: 
8978:         self::$adapter->rollback();
8979: 
8980:         return TRUE;
8981:     }
8982: 
8983:     /**
8984:      * Returns a list of columns. Format of this array:
8985:      * array( fieldname => type )
8986:      * Note that this method only works in fluid mode because it might be
8987:      * quite heavy on production servers!
8988:      *
8989:      * @param  string $table   name of the table (not type) you want to get columns of
8990:      *
8991:      * @return array
8992:      */
8993:     public static function getColumns( $table )
8994:     {
8995:         return self::$writer->getColumns( $table );
8996:     }
8997: 
8998:     /**
8999:      * Generates question mark slots for an array of values.
9000:      *
9001:      * @param array $array
9002:      *
9003:      * @return string
9004:      */
9005:     public static function genSlots( $array )
9006:     {
9007:         return ( count( $array ) ) ? implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $array ), '?' ) ) : '';
9008:     }
9009: 
9010:     /**
9011:      * Nukes the entire database.
9012:      * This will remove all schema structures from the database.
9013:      * Only works in fluid mode. Be careful with this method.
9014:      * 
9015:      * @warning dangerous method, will remove all tables, columns etc.
9016:      *
9017:      * @return void
9018:      */
9019:     public static function nuke()
9020:     {
9021:         if ( !self::$redbean->isFrozen() ) {
9022:             self::$writer->wipeAll();
9023:         }
9024:     }
9025: 
9026:     /**
9027:      * Short hand function to store a set of beans at once, IDs will be
9028:      * returned as an array. For information please consult the R::store()
9029:      * function.
9030:      * A loop saver.
9031:      *
9032:      * @param array $beans list of beans to be stored
9033:      *
9034:      * @return array
9035:      */
9036:     public static function storeAll( $beans )
9037:     {
9038:         $ids = array();
9039:         foreach ( $beans as $bean ) {
9040:             $ids[] = self::store( $bean );
9041:         }
9042: 
9043:         return $ids;
9044:     }
9045: 
9046:     /**
9047:      * Short hand function to trash a set of beans at once.
9048:      * For information please consult the R::trash() function.
9049:      * A loop saver.
9050:      *
9051:      * @param array $beans list of beans to be trashed
9052:      *
9053:      * @return void
9054:      */
9055:     public static function trashAll( $beans )
9056:     {
9057:         foreach ( $beans as $bean ) {
9058:             self::trash( $bean );
9059:         }
9060:     }
9061: 
9062:     /**
9063:      * Toggles Writer Cache.
9064:      * Turns the Writer Cache on or off. The Writer Cache is a simple
9065:      * query based caching system that may improve performance without the need
9066:      * for cache management. This caching system will cache non-modifying queries
9067:      * that are marked with special SQL comments. As soon as a non-marked query
9068:      * gets executed the cache will be flushed. Only non-modifying select queries
9069:      * have been marked therefore this mechanism is a rather safe way of caching, requiring
9070:      * no explicit flushes or reloads. Of course this does not apply if you intend to test
9071:      * or simulate concurrent querying.
9072:      * 
9073:      * @param boolean $yesNo TRUE to enable cache, FALSE to disable cache
9074:      * 
9075:      * @return void
9076:      */
9077:     public static function useWriterCache( $yesNo )
9078:     {
9079:         self::getWriter()->setUseCache( $yesNo );
9080:     }
9081:     
9082: 
9083:     /**
9084:      * A label is a bean with only an id, type and name property.
9085:      * This function will dispense beans for all entries in the array. The
9086:      * values of the array will be assigned to the name property of each
9087:      * individual bean.
9088:      *
9089:      * @param string $type   type of beans you would like to have
9090:      * @param array  $labels list of labels, names for each bean
9091:      *
9092:      * @return array
9093:      */
9094:     public static function dispenseLabels( $type, $labels )
9095:     {
9096:         return self::$labelMaker->dispenseLabels( $type, $labels );
9097:     }
9098:     
9099:     /**
9100:      * Generates and returns an ENUM value. This is how RedBeanPHP handles ENUMs.
9101:      * Either returns a (newly created) bean respresenting the desired ENUM
9102:      * value or returns a list of all enums for the type.
9103:      * 
9104:      * To obtain (and add if necessary) an ENUM value:
9105:      * 
9106:      * $tea->flavour = R::enum( 'flavour:apple' );
9107:      * 
9108:      * Returns a bean of type 'flavour' with  name = apple.
9109:      * This will add a bean with property name (set to APPLE) to the database
9110:      * if it does not exist yet. 
9111:      * 
9112:      * To obtain all flavours:
9113:      * 
9114:      * R::enum('flavour');
9115:      * 
9116:      * To get a list of all flavour names:
9117:      * 
9118:      * R::gatherLabels( R::enum( 'flavour' ) );
9119:      * 
9120:      * @param string $enum either type or type-value
9121:      * 
9122:      * @return array|OODBBean
9123:      */
9124:     public static function enum( $enum ) 
9125:     {
9126:         return self::$labelMaker->enum( $enum );
9127:     }
9128: 
9129:     /**
9130:      * Gathers labels from beans. This function loops through the beans,
9131:      * collects the values of the name properties of each individual bean
9132:      * and stores the names in a new array. The array then gets sorted using the
9133:      * default sort function of PHP (sort).
9134:      *
9135:      * @param array $beans list of beans to loop
9136:      *
9137:      * @return array
9138:      */
9139:     public static function gatherLabels( $beans )
9140:     {
9141:         return self::$labelMaker->gatherLabels( $beans );
9142:     }
9143: 
9144:     /**
9145:      * Closes the database connection.
9146:      *
9147:      * @return void
9148:      */
9149:     public static function close()
9150:     {
9151:         if ( isset( self::$adapter ) ) {
9152:             self::$adapter->close();
9153:         }
9154:     }
9155: 
9156:     /**
9157:      * Simple convenience function, returns ISO date formatted representation
9158:      * of $time.
9159:      *
9160:      * @param mixed $time UNIX timestamp
9161:      *
9162:      * @return string
9163:      */
9164:     public static function isoDate( $time = NULL )
9165:     {
9166:         if ( !$time ) {
9167:             $time = time();
9168:         }
9169: 
9170:         return @date( 'Y-m-d', $time );
9171:     }
9172: 
9173:     /**
9174:      * Simple convenience function, returns ISO date time
9175:      * formatted representation
9176:      * of $time.
9177:      *
9178:      * @param mixed $time UNIX timestamp
9179:      *
9180:      * @return string
9181:      */
9182:     public static function isoDateTime( $time = NULL )
9183:     {
9184:         if ( !$time ) $time = time();
9185: 
9186:         return @date( 'Y-m-d H:i:s', $time );
9187:     }
9188: 
9189:     /**
9190:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9191:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9192:      *
9193:      * @param Adapter $adapter
9194:      *
9195:      * @return void
9196:      */
9197:     public static function setDatabaseAdapter( Adapter $adapter )
9198:     {
9199:         self::$adapter = $adapter;
9200:     }
9201: 
9202:     /**
9203:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9204:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9205:      *
9206:      * @param QueryWriter $writer
9207:      *
9208:      * @return void
9209:      */
9210:     public static function setWriter( QueryWriter $writer )
9211:     {
9212:         self::$writer = $writer;
9213:     }
9214: 
9215:     /**
9216:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9217:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9218:      *
9219:      * @param OODB $redbean
9220:      */
9221:     public static function setRedBean( OODB $redbean )
9222:     {
9223:         self::$redbean = $redbean;
9224:     }
9225: 
9226:     /**
9227:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9228:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9229:      *
9230:      * @return DBAdapter
9231:      */
9232:     public static function getDatabaseAdapter()
9233:     {
9234:         return self::$adapter;
9235:     }
9236:     
9237:     /**
9238:      * Returns the current duplication manager instance.
9239:      * 
9240:      * @return DuplicationManager
9241:      */
9242:     public static function getDuplicationManager()
9243:     {   
9244:         return self::$duplicationManager;
9245:     }
9246: 
9247:     /**
9248:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9249:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9250:      *
9251:      * @return QueryWriter
9252:      */
9253:     public static function getWriter()
9254:     {
9255:         return self::$writer;
9256:     }
9257: 
9258:     /**
9259:      * Optional accessor for neat code.
9260:      * Sets the database adapter you want to use.
9261:      *
9262:      * @return OODB
9263:      */
9264:     public static function getRedBean()
9265:     {
9266:         return self::$redbean;
9267:     }
9268: 
9269:     /**
9270:      * Returns the toolbox currently used by the facade.
9271:      * To set the toolbox use R::setup() or R::configureFacadeWithToolbox().
9272:      * To create a toolbox use Setup::kickstart(). Or create a manual
9273:      * toolbox using the ToolBox class.
9274:      *
9275:      * @return ToolBox
9276:      */
9277:     public static function getToolBox()
9278:     {
9279:         return self::$toolbox;
9280:     }
9281:     
9282:     public static function getExtractedToolbox()
9283:     {
9284:         return array(
9285:             self::$redbean,
9286:             self::$adapter,
9287:             self::$writer,
9288:             self::$toolbox
9289:         );
9290:     }
9291: 
9292:     /**
9293:      * Facade method for AQueryWriter::renameAssociation()
9294:      *
9295:      * @param string|array $from
9296:      * @param string       $to
9297:      *
9298:      * @return void
9299:      */
9300:     public static function renameAssociation( $from, $to = NULL )
9301:     {
9302:         AQueryWriter::renameAssociation( $from, $to );
9303:     }
9304:     
9305:     /**
9306:      * Little helper method for Resty Bean Can server and others.
9307:      * Takes an array of beans and exports each bean.
9308:      * Unlike exportAll this method does not recurse into own lists
9309:      * and shared lists, the beans are exported as-is, only loaded lists
9310:      * are exported.
9311:      * 
9312:      * @param array $beans beans
9313:      * 
9314:      * @return array
9315:      */
9316:     public static function beansToArray( $beans )
9317:     {
9318:         $list = array();
9319:         foreach( $beans as $bean ) {
9320:             $list[] = $bean->export();
9321:         }
9322:         return $list;
9323:     }
9324:     
9325:     /**
9326:      * Dynamically extends the facade with a plugin.
9327:      * Using this method you can register your plugin with the facade and then
9328:      * use the plugin by invoking the name specified plugin name as a method on
9329:      * the facade.
9330:      * 
9331:      * Usage:
9332:      * 
9333:      * R::ext( 'makeTea', function() { ... }  );
9334:      * 
9335:      * Now you can use your makeTea plugin like this:
9336:      * 
9337:      * R::makeTea();
9338:      * 
9339:      * @param string   $pluginName name of the method to call the plugin
9340:      * @param callable $callable   a PHP callable
9341:      */
9342:     public static function ext( $pluginName, $callable )
9343:     {
9344:         if ( !ctype_alnum( $pluginName ) ) {
9345:             throw new RedException( 'Plugin name may only contain alphanumeric characters.' );
9346:         }
9347:         self::$plugins[$pluginName] = $callable;
9348:     }
9349:     
9350:     /**
9351:      * Call static for use with dynamic plugins. This magic method will
9352:      * intercept static calls and route them to the specified plugin.
9353:      *  
9354:      * @param string $pluginName name of the plugin
9355:      * @param array  $params     list of arguments to pass to plugin method
9356:      * 
9357:      * @return mixed
9358:      */
9359:     public static function __callStatic( $pluginName, $params )
9360:     {
9361:         if ( !ctype_alnum( $pluginName) ) {
9362:             throw new RedException( 'Plugin name may only contain alphanumeric characters.' );
9363:         }
9364:         if ( !isset( self::$plugins[$pluginName] ) ) {
9365:             throw new RedException( 'Plugin \''.$pluginName.'\' does not exist, add this plugin using: R::ext(\''.$pluginName.'\')' );
9366:         }
9367:         return call_user_func_array( self::$plugins[$pluginName], $params );
9368:     }
9369: }
9370: 
9371: }
9372: 
9373: namespace RedBeanPHP {
9374: 
9375: use RedBeanPHP\ToolBox as ToolBox;
9376: use RedBeanPHP\AssociationManager as AssociationManager;
9377: use RedBeanPHP\OODB as OODB;
9378: use RedBeanPHP\OODBBean as OODBBean;
9379: use RedBeanPHP\QueryWriter\AQueryWriter as AQueryWriter;
9380: 
9381: /**
9382:  * Duplication Manager
9383:  *
9384:  * @file    RedBean/DuplicationManager.php
9385:  * @desc    Creates deep copies of beans
9386:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
9387:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
9388:  *
9389:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
9390:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
9391:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
9392:  */
9393: class DuplicationManager
9394: {
9395: 
9396:     /**
9397:      * @var ToolBox
9398:      */
9399:     protected $toolbox;
9400: 
9401:     /**
9402:      * @var AssociationManager
9403:      */
9404:     protected $associationManager;
9405: 
9406:     /**
9407:      * @var OODB
9408:      */
9409:     protected $redbean;
9410: 
9411:     /**
9412:      * @var array
9413:      */
9414:     protected $tables = array();
9415: 
9416:     /**
9417:      * @var array
9418:      */
9419:     protected $columns = array();
9420: 
9421:     /**
9422:      * @var array
9423:      */
9424:     protected $filters = array();
9425: 
9426:     /**
9427:      * @var array
9428:      */
9429:     protected $cacheTables = FALSE;
9430: 
9431:     /**
9432:      * Copies the shared beans in a bean, i.e. all the sharedBean-lists.
9433:      *
9434:      * @param OODBBean $copy   target bean to copy lists to
9435:      * @param string           $shared name of the shared list
9436:      * @param array            $beans  array with shared beans to copy
9437:      *
9438:      * @return void
9439:      */
9440:     private function copySharedBeans( OODBBean $copy, $shared, $beans )
9441:     {
9442:         $copy->$shared = array();
9443: 
9444:         foreach ( $beans as $subBean ) {
9445:             array_push( $copy->$shared, $subBean );
9446:         }
9447:     }
9448: 
9449:     /**
9450:      * Copies the own beans in a bean, i.e. all the ownBean-lists.
9451:      * Each bean in the own-list belongs exclusively to its owner so
9452:      * we need to invoke the duplicate method again to duplicate each bean here.
9453:      *
9454:      * @param OODBBean $copy        target bean to copy lists to
9455:      * @param string           $owned       name of the own list
9456:      * @param array            $beans       array with shared beans to copy
9457:      * @param array            $trail       array with former beans to detect recursion
9458:      * @param boolean          $preserveIDs TRUE means preserve IDs, for export only
9459:      *
9460:      * @return void
9461:      */
9462:     private function copyOwnBeans( OODBBean $copy, $owned, $beans, $trail, $preserveIDs )
9463:     {
9464:         $copy->$owned = array();
9465:         foreach ( $beans as $subBean ) {
9466:             array_push( $copy->$owned, $this->duplicate( $subBean, $trail, $preserveIDs ) );
9467:         }
9468:     }
9469: 
9470:     /**
9471:      * Creates a copy of bean $bean and copies all primitive properties (not lists)
9472:      * and the parents beans to the newly created bean. Also sets the ID of the bean
9473:      * to 0.
9474:      *
9475:      * @param OODBBean $bean bean to copy
9476:      *
9477:      * @return OODBBean
9478:      */
9479:     private function createCopy( OODBBean $bean )
9480:     {
9481:         $type = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
9482: 
9483:         $copy = $this->redbean->dispense( $type );
9484: 
9485:         $copy->importFrom( $bean );
9486:         $copy->id = 0;
9487: 
9488:         return $copy;
9489:     }
9490: 
9491:     /**
9492:      * Generates a key from the bean type and its ID and determines if the bean
9493:      * occurs in the trail, if not the bean will be added to the trail.
9494:      * Returns TRUE if the bean occurs in the trail and FALSE otherwise.
9495:      *
9496:      * @param array            $trail list of former beans
9497:      * @param OODBBean $bean  currently selected bean
9498:      *
9499:      * @return boolean
9500:      */
9501:     private function inTrailOrAdd( &$trail, OODBBean $bean )
9502:     {
9503:         $type = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
9504:         $key  = $type . $bean->getID();
9505: 
9506:         if ( isset( $trail[$key] ) ) {
9507:             return TRUE;
9508:         }
9509: 
9510:         $trail[$key] = $bean;
9511: 
9512:         return FALSE;
9513:     }
9514: 
9515:     /**
9516:      * Given the type name of a bean this method returns the canonical names
9517:      * of the own-list and the shared-list properties respectively.
9518:      * Returns a list with two elements: name of the own-list, and name
9519:      * of the shared list.
9520:      *
9521:      * @param string $typeName bean type name
9522:      *
9523:      * @return array
9524:      */
9525:     private function getListNames( $typeName )
9526:     {
9527:         $owned  = 'own' . ucfirst( $typeName );
9528:         $shared = 'shared' . ucfirst( $typeName );
9529: 
9530:         return array( $owned, $shared );
9531:     }
9532: 
9533:     /**
9534:      * Determines whether the bean has an own list based on
9535:      * schema inspection from realtime schema or cache.
9536:      *
9537:      * @param string $type   bean type to get list for
9538:      * @param string $target type of list you want to detect
9539:      *
9540:      * @return boolean
9541:      */
9542:     protected function hasOwnList( $type, $target )
9543:     {
9544:         return isset( $this->columns[$target][$type . '_id'] );
9545:     }
9546: 
9547:     /**
9548:      * Determines whether the bea has a shared list based on
9549:      * schema inspection from realtime schema or cache.
9550:      *
9551:      * @param string $type   bean type to get list for
9552:      * @param string $target type of list you are looking for
9553:      *
9554:      * @return boolean
9555:      */
9556:     protected function hasSharedList( $type, $target )
9557:     {
9558:         return in_array( AQueryWriter::getAssocTableFormat( array( $type, $target ) ), $this->tables );
9559:     }
9560: 
9561:     /**
9562:      * @see DuplicationManager::dup
9563:      *
9564:      * @param OODBBean $bean          bean to be copied
9565:      * @param array            $trail         trail to prevent infinite loops
9566:      * @param boolean          $preserveIDs   preserve IDs
9567:      *
9568:      * @return OODBBean
9569:      */
9570:     protected function duplicate( OODBBean $bean, $trail = array(), $preserveIDs = FALSE )
9571:     {
9572:         if ( $this->inTrailOrAdd( $trail, $bean ) ) return $bean;
9573: 
9574:         $type = $bean->getMeta( 'type' );
9575: 
9576:         $copy = $this->createCopy( $bean );
9577:         foreach ( $this->tables as $table ) {
9578:             
9579:             if ( !empty( $this->filters ) ) {
9580:                 if ( !in_array( $table, $this->filters ) ) continue;
9581:             }
9582: 
9583:             list( $owned, $shared ) = $this->getListNames( $table );
9584: 
9585:             if ( $this->hasSharedList( $type, $table ) ) {
9586:                 if ( $beans = $bean->$shared ) {
9587:                     $this->copySharedBeans( $copy, $shared, $beans );
9588:                 }
9589:             } elseif ( $this->hasOwnList( $type, $table ) ) {
9590:                 if ( $beans = $bean->$owned ) {
9591:                     $this->copyOwnBeans( $copy, $owned, $beans, $trail, $preserveIDs );
9592:                 }
9593: 
9594:                 $copy->setMeta( 'sys.shadow.' . $owned, NULL );
9595:             }
9596: 
9597:             $copy->setMeta( 'sys.shadow.' . $shared, NULL );
9598:         }
9599: 
9600:         $copy->id = ( $preserveIDs ) ? $bean->id : $copy->id;
9601: 
9602:         return $copy;
9603:     }
9604: 
9605:     /**
9606:      * Constructor,
9607:      * creates a new instance of DupManager.
9608:      *
9609:      * @param ToolBox $toolbox
9610:      */
9611:     public function __construct( ToolBox $toolbox )
9612:     {
9613:         $this->toolbox            = $toolbox;
9614:         $this->redbean            = $toolbox->getRedBean();
9615:         $this->associationManager = $this->redbean->getAssociationManager();
9616:     }
9617: 
9618:     /**
9619:      * For better performance you can pass the tables in an array to this method.
9620:      * If the tables are available the duplication manager will not query them so
9621:      * this might be beneficial for performance.
9622:      *
9623:      * @param array $tables
9624:      *
9625:      * @return void
9626:      */
9627:     public function setTables( $tables )
9628:     {
9629:         foreach ( $tables as $key => $value ) {
9630:             if ( is_numeric( $key ) ) {
9631:                 $this->tables[] = $value;
9632:             } else {
9633:                 $this->tables[]      = $key;
9634:                 $this->columns[$key] = $value;
9635:             }
9636:         }
9637: 
9638:         $this->cacheTables = TRUE;
9639:     }
9640: 
9641:     /**
9642:      * Returns a schema array for cache.
9643:      *
9644:      * @return array
9645:      */
9646:     public function getSchema()
9647:     {
9648:         return $this->columns;
9649:     }
9650: 
9651:     /**
9652:      * Indicates whether you want the duplication manager to cache the database schema.
9653:      * If this flag is set to TRUE the duplication manager will query the database schema
9654:      * only once. Otherwise the duplicationmanager will, by default, query the schema
9655:      * every time a duplication action is performed (dup()).
9656:      *
9657:      * @param boolean $yesNo
9658:      */
9659:     public function setCacheTables( $yesNo )
9660:     {
9661:         $this->cacheTables = $yesNo;
9662:     }
9663: 
9664:     /**
9665:      * A filter array is an array with table names.
9666:      * By setting a table filter you can make the duplication manager only take into account
9667:      * certain bean types. Other bean types will be ignored when exporting or making a
9668:      * deep copy. If no filters are set all types will be taking into account, this is
9669:      * the default behavior.
9670:      *
9671:      * @param array $filters
9672:      */
9673:     public function setFilters( $filters )
9674:     {
9675:         if ( !is_array( $filters ) ) {
9676:             $filters = array( $filters );
9677:         }
9678: 
9679:         $this->filters = $filters;
9680:     }
9681: 
9682:     /**
9683:      * Makes a copy of a bean. This method makes a deep copy
9684:      * of the bean.The copy will have the following features.
9685:      * - All beans in own-lists will be duplicated as well
9686:      * - All references to shared beans will be copied but not the shared beans themselves
9687:      * - All references to parent objects (_id fields) will be copied but not the parents themselves
9688:      * In most cases this is the desired scenario for copying beans.
9689:      * This function uses a trail-array to prevent infinite recursion, if a recursive bean is found
9690:      * (i.e. one that already has been processed) the ID of the bean will be returned.
9691:      * This should not happen though.
9692:      *
9693:      * Note:
9694:      * This function does a reflectional database query so it may be slow.
9695:      *
9696:      * Note:
9697:      * this function actually passes the arguments to a protected function called
9698:      * duplicate() that does all the work. This method takes care of creating a clone
9699:      * of the bean to avoid the bean getting tainted (triggering saving when storing it).
9700:      *
9701:      * @param OODBBean $bean          bean to be copied
9702:      * @param array            $trail         for internal usage, pass array()
9703:      * @param boolean          $preserveIDs   for internal usage
9704:      *
9705:      * @return OODBBean
9706:      */
9707:     public function dup( OODBBean $bean, $trail = array(), $preserveIDs = FALSE )
9708:     {
9709:         if ( !count( $this->tables ) ) {
9710:             $this->tables = $this->toolbox->getWriter()->getTables();
9711:         }
9712: 
9713:         if ( !count( $this->columns ) ) {
9714:             foreach ( $this->tables as $table ) {
9715:                 $this->columns[$table] = $this->toolbox->getWriter()->getColumns( $table );
9716:             }
9717:         }
9718: 
9719:         $rs = $this->duplicate( clone( $bean ), $trail, $preserveIDs );
9720: 
9721:         if ( !$this->cacheTables ) {
9722:             $this->tables  = array();
9723:             $this->columns = array();
9724:         }
9725: 
9726:         return $rs;
9727:     }
9728: 
9729:     /**
9730:      * Exports a collection of beans. Handy for XML/JSON exports with a
9731:      * Javascript framework like Dojo or ExtJS.
9732:      * What will be exported:
9733:      * - contents of the bean
9734:      * - all own bean lists (recursively)
9735:      * - all shared beans (not THEIR own lists)
9736:      *
9737:      * @param   array|OODBBean  $beans   beans to be exported
9738:      * @param   boolean                 $parents also export parents
9739:      * @param   array                   $filters only these types (whitelist)
9740:      *
9741:      * @return array
9742:      */
9743:     public function exportAll( $beans, $parents = FALSE, $filters = array() )
9744:     {
9745:         $array = array();
9746: 
9747:         if ( !is_array( $beans ) ) {
9748:             $beans = array( $beans );
9749:         }
9750: 
9751:         foreach ( $beans as $bean ) {
9752:             $this->setFilters( $filters );
9753: 
9754:             $duplicate = $this->dup( $bean, array(), TRUE );
9755: 
9756:             $array[]   = $duplicate->export( FALSE, $parents, FALSE, $filters );
9757:         }
9758: 
9759:         return $array;
9760:     }
9761: }
9762: }
9763: 
9764: namespace RedBeanPHP {
9765: 
9766: /**
9767:  * RedBean Plugin
9768:  *
9769:  * @file    RedBean/Plugin.php
9770:  * @desc    Marker interface for plugins.
9771:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
9772:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
9773:  *
9774:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community
9775:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
9776:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
9777:  */
9778: interface Plugin
9779: {
9780: }
9781: 
9782: ;
9783: }
9784: namespace {
9785: 
9786: //make some classes available for backward compatibility
9787: class RedBean_SimpleModel extends \RedBeanPHP\SimpleModel {};
9788: 
9789: if (!class_exists('R')) {
9790:     class R extends \RedBeanPHP\Facade{};
9791: }
9792: 
9793: 
9794: 
9795: /**
9796:  * Support functions for RedBeanPHP.
9797:  *
9798:  * @file    RedBeanPHP/Functions.php
9799:  * @desc    Additional convenience shortcut functions for RedBeanPHP
9800:  * @author  Gabor de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP community
9801:  * @license BSD/GPLv2
9802:  *
9803:  * copyright (c) G.J.G.T. (Gabor) de Mooij and the RedBeanPHP Community.
9804:  * This source file is subject to the BSD/GPLv2 License that is bundled
9805:  * with this source code in the file license.txt.
9806:  */
9807: 
9808: /**
9809:  * Convenience function for ENUM short syntax in queries.
9810:  * 
9811:  * Usage:
9812:  * 
9813:  * R::find( 'paint', ' color_id = ? ', [ EID('color:yellow') ] );
9814:  * 
9815:  * If a function called EID() already exists you'll have to write this
9816:  * wrapper yourself ;)
9817:  * 
9818:  * @param string $enumName enum code as you would pass to R::enum()
9819:  *
9820:  * @return mixed
9821:  */
9822: if (!function_exists('EID')) {
9823: 
9824:     function EID($enumName)
9825:     {
9826:         return \RedBeanPHP\Facade::enum( $enumName )->id;
9827:     }
9828: 
9829: }
9830: 
9831: }
9832:
UserFrosting Documentation - Master Branch API documentation generated by ApiGen
